datasets.name: sanctions
datasets.title: Consolidated Sanctions
datasets.summary: Consolidated list of sanctioned entities designated by different countries and international organisations. This can include military, trade and travel restrictions.
datasets.description:
This collection combines all designated entities from the various sanctions
lists included in OpenSanctions. It represents the broadest set of
sanctioned people, companies and other assets that is designated globally.

Virtually all sanctions lists are based on the [UN Security Council List](/datasets/un_sc_sanctions/),
and add further listings based on national policies.

The sanctions included here generally impose one or more restrictions like

* freezing of assets
* banning financial transactions, except sometimes for personal living expenses
* travel bans

They may be imposed as a consequence of activities such as funding or association
with organisations involved in terrorism or human rights abuses, or for other
geopolitical reasons.

This excludes restrictions sometimes termed as sanctions such as those imposed
by financial regulators for financial misconduct, or debarments restricting procurement.
Those are included in the [Crime collection](/datasets/crime) instead.

datasets.name: research
datasets.title: OpenSanctions Research Data
datasets.summary: Additional findings regarding specific entities that have been gathered by the OpenSanctions team, included as corrections/errata
datasets.description:
This dataset is used to implement corrections where they're needed on top of
the source data. It also includes ISINs for specific securities subject to sanctions.

publisher.name: OpenSanctions
publisher.description: This data was curated by OpenSanctions and initially submitted by our users and customers.

datasets.name: no_storting
datasets.title: Norway Members of the Storting
datasets.summary: Current and recent members of the Norwegian Storting, the national legislature.
datasets.description:
This dataset provides information about the current and recent members of the Storting,
the Norwegian Parliament. It includes details about each member, such as name, date and
place of birth, parliamentary term, and political affiliation.

publisher.name: Stortinget
publisher.description:
The Storting (Stortinget) is the supreme legislature of Norway, consisting of 169 representatives
elected every four years. It is a unicameral body, meaning it has only one chamber, and is
responsible for making laws, approving the budget, and overseeing the government.

datasets.name: us_finra_actions
datasets.title: US FINRA Enforcement Actions
datasets.summary: Firms and individuals that have faced FINRA disciplinary actions
datasets.description:
This dataset comprises firms and individuals against whom FINRA has taken
disciplinary actions for violations of its rules, federal securities laws,
rules, and regulations or the rules of the Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board.

Documentation of disciplinary actions found here can include official
complaints, decisions, and settlement agreements.

publisher.name: Financial Industry Regulatory Authority
publisher.description:
FINRA is authorized by Congress to protect America's investors by making sure
the broker-dealer industry operates fairly and honestly.

datasets.name: us_ofac_sdn
datasets.title: US OFAC Specially Designated Nationals (SDN) List
datasets.summary: The primary United States' sanctions list, specially designated nationals (SDN) part.
datasets.description:
As part of its enforcement efforts, OFAC publishes a list of individuals and
companies owned or controlled by, or acting for or on behalf of, targeted
countries. It also lists individuals, groups, and entities, such as terrorists
and narcotics traffickers designated under programs that are not country-specific.
Collectively, such individuals and companies are called "Specially Designated
Nationals" or "SDNs." Their assets are blocked and U.S. persons are generally
prohibited from dealing with them.

publisher.name: Office of Foreign Assets Control
publisher.description: OFAC is a divison of the United States Department of the Treasury that administers and enforces economic and trade sanctions based on US foreign policy and national security goals against targeted foreign countries and regimes, terrorists, international narcotics traffickers, those engaged in activities related to the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, and other threats to the national security, foreign policy or economy of the United​ States.

datasets.name: fr_tresor_gels_avoir
datasets.title: French National Asset Freezing System
datasets.summary: The register lists all persons, entities and vessels subject to asset freezing measures in force on French territory, pursuant to national, European and international (UN) provisions.
datasets.description:
By virtue of the provisions of Article L 562-4 of the Monetary and Financial
Code, whether decided by the United Nations, by the European Union or on a
national basis, the asset freezing measures are applicable without deadline
by natural and legal persons.

In order to know the list of persons and entities sanctioned, DG Trésor
publishes and updates the national register of asset freezing measures. This
lists all the people, entities and vessels affected by the asset freezing
measures in force throughout France.

datasets.name: de_abgeordnetenwatch
datasets.title: German Legislators from AbgeordnetenWatch
datasets.summary: Members of the German national legislature (The Bundestag) and state legislatures (Landstag).
datasets.description:
Members of the German national legislature (The Bundestag)
and state legislatures (Landstag) and the positions they occupy
in the legislature, provided by the [Abgeordenetenwatch API](https://www.abgeordnetenwatch.de/api).

Data released under CC0 1.0 license.

publisher.name: Parlamentwatch e.V.
publisher.description:
On abgeordnetenwatch.de (which translates as “member of parliament watch”)
users can find all politicial representatives and ask them questions, read
investigative research and support their demands towards politics for more
transparency.

datasets.name: us_state_terrorist_orgs
datasets.title: US Department of State Foreign Terrorist Organizations
datasets.summary: Foreign Terrorist Organizations (FTOs) pursuant to section 219 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (INA).
datasets.description:
Foreign Terrorist Organizations (FTOs) are entities designated by the U.S. Secretary of State
under Section 219 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (INA). It is unlawful to knowingly
provide these organizations with material support or resources. Non-citizen members of FTOs
may be denied entry into, or removed from, the United States. Additionally, U.S. financial
institutions are required to block and report any assets associated with these organizations
to the U.S. Department of the Treasury.

publisher.name: U.S. Department of State
publisher.description:
The United States Department of State (DOS) is an executive department of
the U.S. federal government responsible for the country's foreign policy
and relations.

datasets.name: lv_fiu_sanctions
datasets.title: Latvia FIU Sanctions and Asset Freezes
datasets.summary: National sanctions list and asset freezes issued by Latvia, expanding on EU regulations.
datasets.description:
This dataset contains lists of individuals or entities subject to national sanctions as specified by laws in Latvia. It also includes a list of asset freezes imposed on entities linked to these individuals or entities.
National sanctions are determined by Latvia's legislative acts and international laws. They are imposed by the Cabinet of Ministers following procedures outlined in the Law on International Sanctions and National Sanctions of the Republic of Latvia.
This dataset further includes [entities owned or controlled by individuals or entities listed in sanctions lists](https://sankcijas.fid.gov.lv/sankciju-subjekti). The listed entity's stake or interest is considered a frozen asset and is included here to aid in the enforcement of sanctions.
It's important to note that the dataset only includes information on financial restrictions imposed on these individuals or entities and does not cover other types of sanctions like restrictions on the circulation of goods.

publisher.name: Finanšu izlūkošanas dienests
publisher.description:
The Financial Intelligence Unit of Latvia is an independent authority and
it's responsibility lies with prevention of money laundering in Latvia, with
the goal of eliminating the possibility of using the Latvian financial
system to launder money or finance terrorism.

datasets.name: us_sanctions
datasets.title: United States Sanctions
datasets.summary: Consolidated list of sanctioned entities designated by different parts of the US federal government.
datasets.description:
This collection combines all designated entities from the various sanctions
lists issues by the US. It's a convenient subset for screening purposes of
entities regulated under US law.

datasets.name: afdb_sanctions
datasets.title: African Development Bank Debarred Entities
datasets.summary: Individuals and firms that have been sanctioned by AfDB, for having participated in coercive, collusive, corrupt, fraudulent or obstructive practices under the Bank’s sanctions system.
datasets.description:
The individuals and firms below have been sanctioned by the African Development
Bank Group or by signatories to the Agreement for Mutual Enforcement of Debarment
Decisions. Sanctions are imposed on entities found to have participated in
coercive, collusive, corrupt, fraudulent or obstructive practices under the
Bank’s sanctions system or adopted under the Agreement for Mutual Enforcement
of Debarment Decisions.

These individuals and firms are therefore considered ineligible to participate in
contracts financed or administered by the African Development Bank Group for
the stipulated periods.

publisher.name: African Development Bank Group
publisher.description:
The African Development Bank (AfDB) Group is a regional multilateral development
finance institution established to contribute to the economic development and
social progress of African countries. The AfDB comprises three entities: the
African Development Bank (ADB), the African Development Fund (ADF) and the
Nigeria Trust Fund (NTF).

datasets.name: eu_travel_bans
datasets.title: EU Consolidated Travel Bans
datasets.summary: Consolidated information about individuals who have been banned from traveling to the European Union, released as part of the EU Sanctions Map.
datasets.description:
This database consolidates all individuals which are disallowed from entering
the European Union. This includes entities designated under the following
EU instruments:

* [Council Decision 2014/145/CFSP of 17 March 2014](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A02014D0145-20220421)
* [Council Decision (CFSP) 2022/837 of 30 May 2022](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.LI.2022.147.01.0003.01.ENG&toc=OJ%3AL%3A2022%3A147I%3ATOC)
* [Council Decision (CFSP) 2016/1693 of 20 September 2016](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A02016D1693-20220221)
* [Council Decision 2013/255/CFSP of 31 May 2013](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A02013D0255-20220226)
* [Council Decision (CFSP) 2022/849 of 30 May 2022](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2022.148.01.0052.01.ENG&toc=OJ%3AL%3A2022%3A148%3ATOC)
* [Council Decision (CFSP) 2016/849 of 27 May 2016](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A02016D0849-20210807)
* [Council Decision (CFSP) 2022/661 of 21 April 2022](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2022.120.01.0014.01.ENG&toc=OJ%3AL%3A2022%3A120%3ATOC)
* [Council Decision 2011/486/CFSP of 1 August 2011](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A02011D0486-20220205)
* [Council Decision (CFSP) 2022/596 of 11 April 2022](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2022.114.01.0068.01.ENG&toc=OJ%3AL%3A2022%3A114%3ATOC)
* [Council Decision 2011/235/CFSP of 12 April 2011](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A02011D0235-20210413)
* [Council Decision 2013/184/CFSP](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A02013D0184-20220221)
* [Council Decision (CFSP) 2022/669 of 21 April 2022](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2022.121.01.0045.01.ENG&toc=OJ%3AL%3A2022%3A121%3ATOC)

Other regulations are also referred to, but include fewer entitites. For context:

* [Press release, 11. May](https://ec.europa.eu/neighbourhood-enlargement/news/implementation-sanctions-commission-publishes-consolidated-list-travel-bans-2022-05-11_en)

publisher.name: Council of the European Union
publisher.description: The Sanctions Map was created by the Estonian Presidency of the EU in 2017.

datasets.name: ch_seco_sanctions
datasets.title: Swiss SECO Sanctions/Embargoes
datasets.summary: Switzerland manages a sanctions lists with a high degree of detail on the individuals that are subject to it's embargoes
datasets.description:
The Confederation can adopt coercive measures to enforce sanctions that have
been decided by the United Nations Organization, the Organization for Security
and Cooperation in Europe or by Switzerland's most important trading partners
and which serve to ensure compliance with international law, in particular
respect for human rights (Art. 1, Para. 1 Embargo Act). The Federal Council
is responsible for enacting the coercive measures (Art. 2, Para. 1 Embargo Act).

* [List of enforcement measures](https://www.seco.admin.ch/seco/de/home/Aussenwirtschaftspolitik_Wirtschaftliche_Zusammenarbeit/Wirtschaftsbeziehungen/exportkontrollen-und-sanktionen/sanktionen-embargos/sanktionsmassnahmen.html)
* [Switzerland's role in international sanctions](https://www.seco.admin.ch/seco/de/home/Aussenwirtschaftspolitik_Wirtschaftliche_Zusammenarbeit/Wirtschaftsbeziehungen/exportkontrollen-und-sanktionen/sanktionen-embargos/die-schweiz-und-internationale-sanktionen.html)

publisher.name: State Secretariat for Economic Affairs
publisher.description:
The State Secretariat for Economic Affairs is the Swiss governments
center of competence for economic, labour and trade matters.

datasets.name: cn_peoples_congress_wikipedia
datasets.title: China National People's Congress on Wikipedia
datasets.summary: Current members of the Chinese National People's Congress
datasets.description:
The National People's Congress (NPC) is the highest organ of
state power of the People's Republic of China. It is the only
branch of the Chinese government, and is unicameral.

The NPC
is elected for a term of five years, and the last election
was held in 2023. Delegates to the National People's Congress
are allowed to hold seats in other bodies of government
simultaneously and the party and the NPC typically includes
all of the senior officials in Chinese politics.

Data sourced from Wikipedia licensed Creative Commons
Attribution-Share Alike 4.0.

See also their [official website](http://www.npc.gov.cn).

publisher.name: Wikipedia
publisher.description:
Wikipedia article about the List of deputies
to the 14th National People's Congress

datasets.name: sg_mas_enforcement_actions
datasets.title: Singapore MAS Enforcement Actions
datasets.summary: Formal regulatory and enforcement actions taken by MAS for breaches of laws and regulations administered by MAS and related matters.
datasets.description:
This dataset contains records of defendants subject to formal enforcement actions by the Monetary
Authority of Singapore (MAS), including both institutions and individuals, for breaches of MAS
regulations and requirements, including market abuse, financial misconduct, and control breaches
related to money laundering.

publisher.name: Monetary Authority of Singapore
publisher.description:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated
financial regulator.

datasets.name: qa_nctc_sanctions
datasets.title: Qatar Unified Record of Persons and Entities on Sanction List
datasets.summary: This dataset contains both UN-mandated and the national sanctions designations for Qatar (Targeted Financial Sanctions).
datasets.description:
> To ensure whether the applicant for business or a customer is designated on
> a UN List or on the Sanction List, the DNFBPs ‘s implementing parties can
> screen the basic data of the applicant for business or the customer on the
> Unified Record of those designated on the Sanction List published on the
> National Counter Terrorism Committee (NCTC) website.

Policy context on the [Ministry of Commerce and Industry website](https://www.moci.gov.qa/en/anti-money-laundering-and-terrorism-financing/legal-framework/).

publisher.name: National Counter Terrorism Committee
publisher.description:
The committee assumes its responsibilities in one of the most important
security areas in order to ensure the achievement of the strategy of
countries in the fight against terrorism through the security related
efforts and cooperation with the relevant bodies as well as the implementation
of the articles of conventions and laws to combat terrorism.

The Committee is keen to coordinate efforts among all its members to implement
the obligations contained in the resolutions of the UN Security Council and
the United Nations resolutions relating to combating terrorism.

datasets.name: us_fed_enforcements
datasets.title: US Federal Reserve Enforcement Actions
datasets.summary: Enforcement actions against entities and individuals for violations of laws, rules, or regulations
datasets.description:
This dataset comprises information about individuals and entities that have
have violated laws, rules, or regulations, unsafe or unsound practices,
breaches of fiduciary duty, and violations of final orders.

From their website:

> Generally, the Federal Reserve takes formal enforcement actions against the
> above entities and individuals for violations of laws, rules, or regulations,
> unsafe or unsound practices, breaches of fiduciary duty, and violations of
> final orders. Formal enforcement actions include cease and desist orders,
> written agreements, prompt corrective action directives, removal and prohibition
> orders, and orders assessing civil money penalties.

publisher.name: Federal Reserve Board
publisher.description: The Federal Reserve works to promote the effective operation of the U.S. economy and, more generally, the public interest.

datasets.name: us_dea_fugitives
datasets.title: US DEA Fugitives
datasets.summary: Fugitives from the US's Drug Enforcement Administration
datasets.description:
The Drug Enforcement Administration's (DEA) consists of persons alleged to have
committed federal violations of laws and regulations related to controlled
substances.

This dataset includes basic demographic information, as well as a summary of
what they are accused of.

publisher.name: Drug Enforcement Administration
publisher.description: The DEA is a U.S. agency tasked with enforcing U.S. controlled substance laws and regulations, and to enable the justice system to take action on those contravening these laws and regulations.

datasets.name: worldbank_debarred
datasets.title: WorldBank Debarred Providers
datasets.summary: The firms and individuals listed in this dataset are debarred and thus ineligible to participate in World Bank-financed contracts for the periods indicated.
datasets.description:
The World Bank Group (IBRD, IDA) maintain a list of companies that are not 
allowed to be awarded projects by its member organisations. Entities are added
either as a consequence of a sanctioning process within the bank (see [here](https://policies.worldbank.org/en/policies/all/ppfdetail/3872) 
for details), or via cross-sanctioning from one of the following other international
development banks: 

* Asian Development Bank
* European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
* Inter-American Development Bank
* African Development Bank

nb. This cross-debarment process looks to be somewhat manual. OpenSanctions should
crawl all of the involved banks and reconcile their lists.

### Notes

* For entities that have been permanently excluded from procurement, the sanction end
  date is given as 2999-12-31.

publisher.name: World Bank
publisher.description:
The World Bank Group of organisations (most notably the IBRD and IDA) are a set of
global development banks that provide finance with the ultimate goal of ending
extreme poverty.

datasets.name: mt_parlament
datasets.title: Malta Members of Parliament
datasets.summary: Current and recent Members of the Parliament of Malta
datasets.description:
Members of the Parliament of Malta (Maltese: Parlament ta' Malta), the constitutional
legislative body of Malta.

The Parliament is unicameral, consisting of the House of Representatives with a minimum
of 65 members elected by proportional representation through the single transferable
vote system. Members are elected from 13 electoral districts for a five-year term,
though elections may be called earlier.

The data includes members from recent legislative periods (legislatures), capturing
current and recent parliamentarians across different political groups.

publisher.name: Parliament of Malta
publisher.description:
The Parliament of Malta provides information about members of parliament
through its official website, organized by legislative period and political
groups. The site includes biographical information and political affiliations
for parliamentarians.

datasets.name: br_tcu_debarred
datasets.title: Brazil List of Debarred Bidders
datasets.summary: The TCU list of Debarred Bidders is a catalog of individuals and companies sanctioned by Brazil's Tribunal de Contas da União, prohibiting them from participating in public procurement processes.
datasets.description:
The TCU compiles a list of those declared debarred from participating in federal public
administration tenders, under the terms of art. 46 of the Organic Law of the Court (Law 8.443/92).
Processes that are ongoing or whose decisions have not become final are not considered.

publisher.name: Tribunal de Contas da União
publisher.description: Brazil's Federal Court of Accounts

datasets.name: us_ma_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Massachusetts Suspensions and Exclusions from MassHealth
datasets.summary: Providers who have been suspended or excluded from the MassHealth program.
datasets.description:
> The MassHealth program maintains a list of providers who have been suspended or excluded
> from participating in the MassHealth program. This list is updated monthly and reflects
> suspensions or exclusions effective on or after March 23, 2010. They are listed according to
> the provider type at the time of such action.

publisher.name: MassHealth
publisher.description: MassHealth is the combination of the Medicaid and Children's Health Insurance Program in Massachusetts.

datasets.name: ann_graph_topics
datasets.title: Graph-based entity tagging
datasets.summary: Automatically generated graph-based topic annotations
datasets.description:
This data sources stores annotations of entities which are adjacent to other
risk-linked entities. For example, a person linked via a family bond to a PEP
is considered a "relative or close associate" (RCA). Similarly, entities
linked to sanctioned entities (especially subsidiaries) are tagges as
"sanction-linked".

publisher.name: OpenSanctions
publisher.description:
OpenSanctions is the company behind the OpenSanctions database of persons
and companies of political, criminal, or economic interest.

datasets.name: az_fiu_sanctions
datasets.title: Azerbaijan Domestic List
datasets.summary: Domestic list of natural and legal persons subject to sanctions
datasets.description:
This sanctions list is published by the Government of Azerbaijan. For context,
Azerbaijan is run by an authoritarian regime that is, itself, credibly
accused of a large number of financial crimes.

* [More details on Freedom House](https://freedomhouse.org/country/azerbaijan).

publisher.name: Azerbaijan Financial Monitoring Service
publisher.description:
The Financial Monitoring Service of the Republic of Azerbaijan (FMS) is a body
exercising powers in the field of anti-money laundering and combating the
financing of terrorism as defined by Law as well as participating in
policymaking in this area.

datasets.name: ext_us_irs_ffi
datasets.title: US FATCA Foreign Financial Institution (FFI) List
datasets.summary: All foreign financial institutions and branches with approved FATCA registration.
datasets.description:
The FFI list is issued by the IRS and includes all financial institutions, branches, direct
reporting non-financial foreign entities, sponsored entities, and sponsored subsidiary branches
that have submitted a registration and have been assigned a Global Intermediary Identification
Number (GIIN) at the time the list was compiled.

On the first day of each month, a complete new list is published for all entities that have an
assigned and approved GIIN as of a specified cut-off date.
[Source](https://www.irs.gov/businesses/corporations/irs-ffi-list-faqs)

publisher.name: Internal Revenue Service
publisher.description:
The IRS is a bureau of the Department of the Treasury. In the United States, the Congress passes
tax laws and requires taxpayers to comply. The taxpayer’s role is to understand and meet his or
her tax obligations. The IRS role is to help the large majority of compliant taxpayers with the
tax law, while ensuring that the minority who are unwilling to comply pay their fair share.
[Source: Official Website](https://www.irs.gov/about-irs/the-agency-its-mission-and-statutory-authority)

datasets.name: us_wa_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Washington State Provider Termination and Exclusion List
datasets.summary: Medical providers terminated or excluded from Washington State's Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
This dataset includes individuals or entities whose participation in the Medicaid
program has been terminated for cause under the provision of WAC 182-502-0030 (HCA)
or 388-113-0020; 388-113-0030; 388-71-0540 (DSHS) and Medicaid providers who have
been excluded from participation (see 42 CFR 1001).

publisher.name: Washington State Health Care Authority
publisher.description:
> HCA purchases and coordinates health care services including behavioral health
> treatment for more than 2.7 million Washington residents and provides behavioral
> health prevention, crisis, and recovery supports to all Washington residents.

datasets.name: ext_ror
datasets.title: Research Organizations Registry
datasets.summary: Identifiers for research organizations, maintained by the Research Organization Registry.
datasets.description:
ROR is a registry of “research organizations.” We define “research organization” as any
organization that conducts, produces, manages, or touches research.

publisher.name: Research Organization Registry
publisher.description:
ROR is a community-led project to develop an open, sustainable, usable, and unique
identifier for every research organization in the world.

datasets.name: id_regional_2018
datasets.title: Indonesia 2018 Regional Head Election Results
datasets.summary: Governors, Regents, and Mayors elected in the 2018 Indonesian regional elections
datasets.description:
This provides names and positions of governors, mayors and regents elected in the 2018 regional election in Indonesia.

The data was originally sourced from the Indonesian General Election Commission open data portal. This datasource now
operates on the last archived copy of the original data, retrieved at 2025-04-09, after which the website went
offline.

publisher.name: Komisi Pemilihan Umum
publisher.description:
The KPU - the General Election Commission of the Republic of Indonesia - is mandated to
> Coordinate, organize, control and monitor all stages of elections
in Indonesia.

datasets.name: gem_energy_ownership
datasets.title: Global Energy Ownership Tracker
datasets.summary: Information on the chain of ownership for various energy projects. The data maps each level of the chain from the direct owner up to their highest-level ultimate parents.
datasets.description:
The Global Energy Ownership Tracker provides information on the chain of ownership for
various energy projects. The data maps each level of the chain from the direct owner
(as in, the lowest-level identified owner in the chain of ownership) up to their
highest-level ultimate parents (e.g., corporations, investment firms, and governments).

Ownership links are reported with the percentage of ownership, including owners that have
controlling interest as well as those with minority, non-controlling interests (if over a
threshold of 5% ownership).

This data is from the Global Energy Ownership Tracker by Global Energy Monitor which
they license under the
[Creative Commons CC BY 4.0 International license](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

publisher.name: Global Energy Monitor
publisher.description:
Global Energy Monitor develops and analyzes data on energy infrastructure, resources, and uses.
It provides open access to information that is essential to building a sustainable energy future.

datasets.name: us_cia_world_factbook
datasets.title: US CIA World Factbook Heads of State and Government
datasets.summary: An index of most national-level heads of state and heads of government in world governments that is publicly maintained by the CIA.
datasets.description:
This dataset makes the "chief of state", as labeled here, and head of government,
available for all countries in the World Factbook which have such roles.

Where a monarch has a local representative of e.g. an ex-colony, both the
monarch and any local representatives are generally included.

The World Factbook source pages contain much more narrative about each country.
From the website:

> The World Factbook provides basic intelligence on the history, people,
> government, economy, energy, geography, environment, communications,
> transportation, military, terrorism, and transnational issues for 266 world
> entities.

datasets.name: eu_esma_sanctions
datasets.title: EU ESMA Sanctions
datasets.summary: List of sanctioned entities, as published by the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA).
datasets.description:
Register of entities sanctioned by European NCAs and maintained by ESMA.
The directives and regulations underpinning the sanctions can be found in the [Interactive Single Rulebook.](https://www.esma.europa.eu/publications-and-data/interactive-single-rulebook)
> Compilation of sanctions applied and published in Member States under CSDR, EMIR, MAD, MAR, MiFID, SFTR, UCITS.

publisher.name: European Securities and Markets Authority
publisher.description:
ESMA is the EU’s financial markets regulator and supervisor. It publishes a
number of databases and registers, including the Financial Instruments Reference
Data System (FIRDS).

datasets.name: us_or_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Oregon State Medicaid Fraud Convictions
datasets.summary: Medical providers convicted of medicaid fraud in the state of Oregon
datasets.description:
Oregon Health Authority's
Program Integrity Audit Unit audits Oregon
Medicaid Providers and contractors for compliance with state
and federal requirements in order to prevent fraud, waste
and abuse in Oregon's Medicaid Program.

This dataset contains information about entities that have
been convicted of state medicaid fraud.

publisher.name: Oregon Health Authority's Program Integrity Audit Unit
publisher.description:
> The Oregon Health Authority's Program Integrity Audit Unit
> (PIAU) supports the responsible stewardship of Medicaid
> funds in three ways:
> - Auditing Oregon Medicaid providers and contractors for
  compliance with state and federal requirements;
> - Educating providers about Medicaid Program Integrity
  requirements; and
> - Oversight of Oregon's Medicaid operations.

datasets.name: cn_sanctions
datasets.title: China Sanctions Research
datasets.summary: Individuals and organisations targeted by the Anti-Foreign Sanctions Law, Counter-Measures List and the Unreliable Entities List (UEL).
datasets.description:
China does not publish structured data on individuals and entities targeted by the
country's sanctions legislation. This dataset is a partial list of individuals and
organisations that have been mentioned by spokespeople of the government as
designated.

Chinese sanctions are often framed as countermeasures against foreign sanctions
and to reprimand public figures for critizing China's policies, particularly
regarding Hong Kong, Taiwan, and Xinjiang province.

As of 2024-03-08, only two companies are officially listed as part of the Unreliable
Entities List (UEL).

**Note**: This dataset is not comprehensive and should be used as a research
tool but not as a definitive source of sanctions data on China.

* [How China imposes sanctions](https://merics.org/en/report/how-china-imposes-sanctions) (MERICS)
* [MFA Anti-Sanctions List and Measures](https://www.mfa.gov.cn/wjb_673085/zfxxgk_674865/gknrlb/fzcqdcs/)

publisher.name: OpenSanctions
publisher.description:
This dataset comnbines data published by various government departments,
including:

The Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China, is a state
agency of the People's Republic of China responsible for the regulation of
economic activities such as trade, commodity inspection and industry.

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China is a
ministry of the Chinese government responsible for the country's foreign
relations.

datasets.name: us_nh_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US New Hampshire Medicaid Exclusion and Sanction List
datasets.summary: Providers who have been terminated for cause from New Hampshire's Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
The New Hampshire Department of Health & Human Services maintains a list of providers
whose Medicaid provider agreement has been terminated. Providers listed are not allowed to receive
reimbursement for Medicaid services in any capacity.

publisher.name: New Hampshire Department of Health & Human Services
publisher.description: The New Hampshire Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) is responsible for the health, safety and well-being of the citizens of New Hampshire. DHHS provides services for individuals, children, families and seniors, and administers programs and services such as mental health, developmental disability, substance misuse, and public health.

datasets.name: ca_listed_terrorists
datasets.title: Canadian Listed Terrorist Entities
datasets.summary: The Canadian government's own list of people and organizations associated with terrorism
datasets.description:
> The listing of an entity is a public means of identifying a group or individual as
> being associated with terrorism. The definition of an entity includes a person,
> group, trust, partnership or fund, or an unincorporated association or
> organization. The [Anti-Terrorism Act](https://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/A-11.7/index.html)
> provides measures for the Government of Canada to create a list of entities.

> It is not a crime to be listed. However, one of the consequences of being listed is
> that the entity's property can be the subject of seizure/restraint and/or forfeiture.
> In addition, institutions such as banks, brokerages, etc. are subject to
> reporting requirements with respect to an entity's property and must not allow
> those entities to access the property.  These institutions may not deal or
> otherwise dispose of the property. It is an offence to knowingly participate
> in or contribute to, directly or indirectly, any activity of a terrorist group.
> This participation is only an offence if its purpose is to enhance the ability of
> any terrorist group to facilitate or carry out a terrorist activity.

publisher.name: Public Safety Canada
publisher.description:
The list is composed by the Minister of Public Safety, and approved by the
Governor in Council.

datasets.name: us_fcc_covered_list
datasets.title: US FCC Covered List
datasets.summary: List of companies that produce equipment and services covered by section 2 of the Secure Networks Act
datasets.description:
This dataset consists of entities listed on the FCC Covered List. That list is described as

> communications equipment and services
> deemed to pose an unacceptable risk to the national security of the United States
> or the security and safety of United States persons based exclusively on any of
> four sources for such a determination and that such equipment or services possess
> certain capabilities as enumerated in section 2(a) of the Secure and Trusted
> Communications Networks Act of 2019, Pub. L. No. 116-124, 133 Stat. 158 (2020)
> (codified as amended at 47 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1609)

Further noted on the list:

> The inclusion of producers or providers of equipment or services identified on this
> list should be read to include the subsidiaries and affiliates of such entities.

> Where equipment or services on the list are identified by category, such category
> should be construed to include only equipment or services capable of the functions
> outlined in sections 2(b)(2)(A), (B), or (C) of the Secure and Trusted Communications
> Networks Act of 2019, 47 U.S.C. § 1601(b)(2)(A)-(C).

As of December 22, 2025, the source listing also includes a broad entry that covers
all uncrewed aircraft systems (UAS) and UAS critical components produced in a foreign
country (with some exceptions) as well as all communications and video surveillance
equipment specified in Section 1709(a)(1) of the FY25 National Defense Authorization Act.
These are not included in this dataset, as they amount to sector-level debarments rather
than a list of entities.

This dataset is manually maintained and is updated shortly after changes to the source.

publisher.name: Federal Communications Comission
publisher.description:
> The Federal Communications Commission regulates interstate and international
> communications by radio, television, wire, satellite, and cable in all 50
> states, the District of Columbia and U.S. territories. An independent U.S.
> government agency overseen by Congress, the Commission is the federal agency
> responsible for implementing and enforcing America’s communications law and
> regulations.

datasets.name: ext_lv_business_register
datasets.title: Register of Enterprises of the Republic of Latvia (Uzņēmumu reģistrs)
datasets.summary: Directors, shareholders and beneficial owners as well as bank accounts for companies and traders in the country's Register of Enterprises which match or are related to entities in the OpenSanctions database

publisher.name: Latvijas Republikas Uzņēmumu reģistrs
publisher.description:
The Register of Enterprises of the Republic of Latvia is a state
institution that registers enterprises, merchants, their branches
and representative offices, as well as all changes in the basic documents of
their operation, and performs other activities provided for by legislative acts
in the territory of the Republic of Latvia.

datasets.name: ru_navalny35
datasets.title: Navalny 35 List of Individuals for Sanctioning
datasets.summary: A list of suggested sanctions targets published by Navalny's FBK in a letter to Dominic Raab.
datasets.description:
This list was created in response to the poisining of Alexei Navalny by the
Russian security services. It designates individuals who are directly or
indirectly responsible for the attack.

publisher.name: Anti-Corruption Foundation
publisher.description:
Фонд борьбы с коррупцией is an anti-corruption NGO linked to the political
network of imprisoned Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny.

datasets.name: lt_pep_declarations
datasets.title: Lithuania PEPs from the register of private interests
datasets.summary: Lithuanian PEPs based on official declarations of personal interests.
datasets.description:
The Law on Harmonization of Public and Private Interests Article 2, Paragraph 5
and Article 4, Paragraph 3 require persons in positions that can influence the
decisions of state institutions to declare their private interests.

The [list of roles required to submit declarations](https://vtek.lt/privaciu-interesu-deklaravimas/kas-turi-deklaruoti/)
includes state politicians, party leadership, public servants, judges, and senior
leadership or public administrative bodies.

publisher.name: Lithuanian Chief Official Ethics Commission
publisher.description: Supreme Official Ethics Commission (VTEK) works to ensure that public institutions and the persons working in them ethically serve the people.

datasets.deprecation:
As of April 2025, the Lithuanian Chief Official Ethics Commission (VTEK) has required
API authentication for access to the declarations search page, which prevents
automated crawling of the data. We've [reached out to VTEK to request access](https://github.com/opensanctions/opensanctions/issues/2212), but 
not received a response yet. The dataset is therefore marked as deprecated and eventually
removed in favor of other sources of PEP data for Lithuania.

datasets.name: nz_russia_sanctions
datasets.title: New Zealand Russia Sanctions
datasets.summary: The New Zealand government's list of people and companies sanctioned in relation to the Russian attack on Ukraine.
datasets.description:
> The sanctions register is published to help New Zealanders comply with Russia
> sanctions and is regularly updated as the sanctions regime matures and responds
> to the invasion of Ukraine. You can search and filter the list, which includes
> names and details of sanctioned individuals and entities, types of sanction,
> and trade measures.
>
> Please refer to the [Russia Sanctions Regulations 2022](https://www.legislation.govt.nz/act/public/2022/0006/latest/whole.html), and any amendments,
> for the details and list of sanctions.

publisher.name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade
publisher.description: The list is composed by the Ministers of Foreign Affairs and Trade in New Zealand

datasets.name: us_ddtc_enforcements
datasets.title: US Directorate of Defense Trade Controls Penalties & Oversight Agreements
datasets.summary: Consent agreements entered into by parties accused of violating the Arms  Export Control Act (AECA) or International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR)
datasets.description:
This dataset provides a current and historical list of names of current individuals
and companies who entered into consent agreements
with the Directorate of Defense Trade Controls (DDTC) to settle allegations of violations
of the AECA or ITAR. 

It includes a short description of the allegations and a link
to the charging letter for each instance when available.

The publisher's page (link provided) additionally publishes the agreement and the order
of remediation actions.

From the DDTC page:

> Pursuant to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) §127.10, the 
> Assistant Secretary for Political-Military Affairs is authorized to impose civil 
> penalties for violations of the Arms Export Control Act (AECA) and the ITAR. 
> Imposition of civil penalties generally includes the payment of fines to the U.S. 
> Treasury and a Consent Agreement, under which the company is required to institute 
> enhanced compliance measures. The Consent Agreement outlines the measures required 
> to enhance compliance programs.
>
> Consent Agreements and accompanying documents are made available to the public.
> Current and past agreements are provided

publisher.name: Directorate of Defense Trade Controls
publisher.description:
The Directorate of Defense Trade Controls (DDTC) ensures commercial exports
of defense articles and defense services advance U.S. national security and
foreign policy objectives.

datasets.name: mk_officials
datasets.title: North Macedonia Elected and Appointed Officials
datasets.summary: Data on Politically Exposed Persons from asset declarations of elected and appointed officials in North Macedonia
datasets.description:
North Macedonia has an asset declaration system established by the Law
on Prevention of Corruption (LPC, 2002) for elected and appointed officials,
responsible persons in public entities dealing with State funds, and officials
in State bodies and municipal administrations, including judges and prosecutors. 

The obligated personnel are required to submit asset declarations to designated offices
upon taking and leaving office and whenever a change in assets occurs that exceeds
twenty average salaries.

publisher.name: State Commission for Prevention of Corruption
publisher.description:
The State Commission for Prevention of Corruption (SCPC) is an autonomous and
independent national body assigned a variety of preventive and repressive
functions against corruption.

datasets.name: eu_edes
datasets.title: EU Early Detection and Exclusion System (EDES)
datasets.summary: List of persons or entities excluded from contracts financed by the EU budget.
datasets.description:
> The economic operators listed below have been excluded from participation in
> EU procurement procedures, grant award procedures, prizes procedures, financial
> instruments and procedures for selection of experts or any other form of 
> contribution from the EU budget for the periods mentioned and/or have been
> imposed a financial penalty. Therefore, they cannot be awarded any contract
> financed by the EU budget.
> 
> Please note that the list below concerns only the cases for which a decision
> was taken to publish in order to, where necessary, reinforce the deterrent
> effect of the sanctions. Other cases of exclusions and financial penalty are
> listed in the Commission's database (EDES-DB) which is only accessible to
> authorised users involved in the implementation of the EU budget.

publisher.name: European Commission
publisher.description:
The European Commission is the executive branch of the European Union. It has
set up a panel which administers the EDES system and will handle the removal
of entities from the list.

datasets.name: us_la_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Louisiana Department of Health Adverse Actions List
datasets.summary: Medical providers excluded from Louisiana's Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
This dataset contains individuals and entities excluded from Louisiana state medicaid program.
According to their website:

> Any person or entity is prohibited from participation in Medicaid if excluded, to include:
> employment directly or indirectly, contracting, or ownership. Doing so while excluded is
> violation and is considered a crime under LA R.S. 14:126.3.1 (2009). Although the stated
> period of time for the exclusion may have passed, this does not imply reinstatement. After
> the exclusion period has ended the excluded party may submit a written application for
> reinstatement. Resumption of participation in the Medicaid Program following exclusion is
> neither automatic nor a right. Applications for reinstatement will be reviewed by the
> state and given fair and impartial consideration. La.-R.S. 46:437.13 (C) (2008).

Entities on this list due to the OIG LEIE are not re-listed in this dataset.

publisher.name: Louisiana Department of Health
publisher.description:
> The Louisiana Department of Health protects and promotes health and ensures access to
> medical, preventive and rehabilitative services for all citizens of the state of Louisiana.

datasets.name: ge_declarations
datasets.title: Georgia Public Official Asset Declarations
datasets.summary: Politically exposed persons from Georgia based on property declarations of public officials.
datasets.description:
The Georgian Anti-Corruption law of 2015 requires public officials to submit
annual declarations of their assets, as well as members of their family and their assets.

Officials making declarations here include national and sub-national members of the executive,
legislature and judiciary. These are included in our dataset as Politically Exposed Persons,
as well as their members of family. We exclude candidates who have not yet been elected.

**Note:** This crawler uses an LLM-based approach to transliterate person and company names
and translate position labels.

publisher.name: ანტიკორუფციული ბიურო
publisher.description:
The Anti-Corruption Bureau determines the general policy of fighting against
corruption, to develop a national anti-corruption strategy and action plan and
to monitor the implementation of the mentioned plan. It seeks to prevent, detect and
prevent conflicts of interest in public institutions and develop relevant proposals
and recommendations.

datasets.name: ch_finma_rulings
datasets.title: Swiss FINMA Final Rulings
datasets.summary: Switzerland's financial regulator maintains and publishes final rulings naming those involved in financial misconduct
datasets.description:
> Article 34 FINMASA gives FINMA the power to publish all or part of
> its final rulings on serious violations of supervisory law, including
> personal details of those involved, once a ruling has become legally
> binding and it provides for this.

publisher.name: Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority
publisher.description:
FINMA is Switzerland’s independent financial-markets regulator. Its mandate
is to supervise banks, insurance companies, financial institutions,
collective investment schemes, and their asset managers and fund
management companies.

datasets.name: cz_terrorists
datasets.title: Czech National Anti-Terrorism Designations (Government Regulation No. 210/2008)
datasets.summary: Individuals and groups designated under Czech Government Regulation No. 210/2008 in line with EU anti-terrorism measures.
datasets.description:
This dataset is based on Czech Government Regulation No. 210/2008 Coll., issued on 28 May 2008
and amended by Regulation No. 88/2009 Coll. (effective 1 April 2009), to support EU efforts
against terrorism. It lists individuals and groups that are banned from receiving certain goods,
services, or support.

datasets.name: regulatory
datasets.title: Regulatory Watchlists
datasets.summary: Entities that are subject to regulatory actions and restrictions
datasets.description:
This collection includes datasets that track individuals and entities that
are subject to regulatory actions and restrictions, such as investor warnings,
penalities and fines, or bans from specific activities or industries.

These watchlists are maintained by government agencies, international
organizations, or other regulatory bodies.

datasets.name: in_sansad
datasets.title: India Lok and Rajya Sabha Members
datasets.summary: Current and historical members of the two houses of the Indian Parliament
datasets.description:
Members of the Lok Sabha (House of the People), the lower house of the Parliament of
India, and the Rajya Sabha (Council of States), the upper house.

The Lok Sabha consists of up to 552 members, with 543 elected by direct popular vote
from single-member constituencies across India, and up to 9 appointed by the President
to represent the Anglo-Indian community. Members serve a five-year term, unless the house
is dissolved earlier.

The Rajya Sabha has a maximum of 250 members, with 238 elected by the legislative assemblies
of the states and union territories using proportional representation through the single
transferable vote system, and 12 appointed by the President for their expertise in specific
fields. Members serve staggered six-year terms, with one-third of the members retiring every
two years.

publisher.name: Parliament of India
publisher.description:
The Parliament of India is the supreme legislative body of the Republic of India,
consisting of the President of India and the two houses: the Rajya Sabha (Council of
States) and the Lok Sabha (House of the People). The Parliament exercises legislative
power, approves the budget, and oversees the executive branch of government.

datasets.name: us_bis_denied
datasets.title: US BIS Denied Persons List
datasets.summary: The Bureau of Industry and Security publishes this list of entities which are relevant with regards to export controls.
datasets.description:
The Denied Persons List is a list of people and companies whose export
privileges have been denied by the Department of Commerce's Bureau of
Industry and Security (BIS). An American company or individual may not
participate in an export transaction with an individual or company on the
Denied Persons List.

The Denied Persons List is also included in the [US Trade Consolidated List](/datasets/us_trade_csl/),
so we may want to remove this crawler at some point.

publisher.name: Bureau of Industry and Security
publisher.description:
BIS is part of the U.S. Department of Commerce, where it manages the intersection between
business and the foreign policy and security interests of the U.S.

datasets.name: za_mm_officials
datasets.title: South Africa Municipal Leadership
datasets.summary: Profiles of municipal heads in South Africa, focusing on key political figures  such as the Mayor and Municipal Manager.
datasets.description:
The dataset provides information on Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) across all 
municipalities in South Africa. It focuses on individuals holding key positions 
of influence, including Mayor/Executive Mayor and Municipal Manager, within each 
municipality.

publisher.name: National Treasury of South Africa
publisher.description:
The Constitution of the Republic (Chapter 13) mandates the National Treasury to ensure
transparency, accountability and sound financial controls in the management of public finances.

datasets.name: it_deputies
datasets.title: Italy Members of the Chamber of Deputies
datasets.summary: Current and recent members of the Italian Chamber of Deputies, the lower chamber of Parliament.
datasets.description:
This dataset provides information about the current and recent deputies. For each deputy,
it includes name, date and place of birth, political affiliation, and other relevant information.

publisher.name: Camera dei deputati
publisher.description:
The Chamber of Deputies is the lower house of the Italian Parliament, with the Senate
of the Republic serving as the upper house. Together, the two houses form a perfectly
bicameral system, meaning they share identical legislative functions but operate
independently. The Chamber of Deputies has 400 seats, of which 392 are elected from
constituencies within Italy and 8 are reserved for Italian citizens residing abroad.

datasets.name: gb_hmt_sanctions
datasets.title: UK HMT/OFSI Consolidated List of Targets
datasets.summary: The United Kingdom's consolidated international sanctions list.
datasets.description:
The Office of Financial Sanctions Implementation (OFSI) publishes a list of all
those subject to financial sanctions imposed by the UK which it keeps updated.

You can find more information about the [current UK sanctions regimes here](https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/uk-sanctions-regimes-under-the-sanctions-act)
and read the [guidance](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/financial-sanctions-faqs).

The UK sanctions list suffers from very bad data quality as the result of manual
data processing and inappropriate data structures used by the XML files.

publisher.name: Office of Financial Sanctions Implementation
publisher.description: OFSI is part of Her Majesty's Treasury. It helps to ensure that financial sanctions are properly understood, implemented and enforced in the United Kingdom.

datasets.deprecation:
The UK HMT/OFSI Consolidated List of Targets dataset has been consolidated into the FCDO [UK Sanctions List](/datasets/gb_fcdo_sanctions/) as of January 2026. There will be no further updates to this dataset after January 28, 2026. Read our [changelog entry](/changelog/38/) for more details.
We further plan to remove the `sanction` topic from entries in this dataset after its deprecation, and will eventually remove the dataset entirely to avoid processing stale designations.

datasets.name: ua_war_sanctions
datasets.title: Ukraine War and Sanctions
datasets.summary: Sponsors and accomplices of Russian armed aggression against Ukraine.
datasets.description:
The War and Sanctions website provides detailed information on ongoing sanctions targeting
Russia and its allies, alongside profiles of individuals and entities that actively support
the war against Ukraine but remain unsanctioned by Western nations. The dataset is
categorized into the following sections:

**Child Kidnappers**: Individuals and entities involved in the deportation of Ukrainian
children.

**Champions of Terror**: Athletes whom Russia uses to propagate its agenda.

**Marine and Aircraft Assets**: Airports, ports, and vessels involved in the transportation
of weapons, stolen Ukrainian goods, and sanctions circumvention efforts.

**Vessel captains**: Captains of vessels involved in sanctions circumvention efforts.

**Propagandists**: Individuals involved in the dissemination of Russian propaganda.

**UAVs manufacturers**: Companies involved in the production of unmanned aerial vehicles,
which are systematically used to target Ukraine's civilian population, alongside their
military applications.

**Executives of War**: Officials, security agencies, and defense industry representatives
shaping Russia’s military-industrial policy, defense orders, and wartime economy.

**Stealers of Heritage**: Individuals and entities involved in the theft and destruction of
Ukrainian cultural heritage.

**Russian Military-industrial complex**: Enterprises belonging to the three military holdings
of the Russian state corporation Rostec—High-Precision Systems, United Aircraft Corporation, and
United Engine Corporation—which develop and produce missiles, combat aircraft, and engines
used in Russia’s war against Ukraine.

**Military Component Manufacturers**: Enterprises involved in the production and supply of
military components and parts.

The objective of the War and Sanctions website is to raise awareness of their conduct,
and advocate for sanctions against these entities to hold perpetrators accountable and
deter further actions of this kind.

publisher.name: ГУР МО України
publisher.description: The Defence Intelligence of Ukraine is the main intelligence agency of the Ministry of Defence of Ukraine. It protects the national interests of Ukraine, counter the threats to national security, and provides intelligence support to the country's leadership and the Armed Forces of Ukraine. [Source: Official Website](https://gur.gov.ua/en/content/directions.html)

datasets.name: us_ny_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US New York State Medicaid Exclusions
datasets.summary: Medical providers deemed ineligible to participate in New York State's Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
The New York State Office of the Medicaid Inspector General maintains a list of providers
whose Medicaid provider agreement has been terminated. Providers listed are not allowed to receive
reimbursement for Medicaid services in any capacity.

publisher.name: New York State Office of the Medicaid Inspector General
publisher.description: > The Office of the Medicaid Inspector General is an independent entity created within the New York State Department of Health to promote and protect the integrity of the Medicaid program in New York State.

datasets.name: mx_governors
datasets.title: Mexico Governors
datasets.summary: Current and former governors of Mexico states and the Head of Government of Mexico City.
datasets.description:
This dataset includes information about current and
former state governors from Mexico, as of 2024-09-06.

Mexico is a federation comprising 32 states, each with its own governor. The
Head of Government of Mexico City is not considered a governorship but is
included in this list.

State governors serve six-year terms, and, similar to the President of Mexico,
they are prohibited from seeking reelection. Individuals who have previously
held a governorship are ineligible to run for or serve in the post again.

This data was originally source from the website of the National Governors' Conference,
which has since gone offline. This dataset operates on the last archived copy of the
original data from the Internet Archive, retrieved on 2024-09-06.

publisher.name: Conferencia Nacional de Gobernadores
publisher.description: National Governors' Conference

datasets.name: wd_oligarchs
datasets.title: Russian Oligarch/Billionaires Database
datasets.summary: A list of billionaires and oligarchs from CIS countries, most notably the Russian Federation.
datasets.description:
This list was developed by the OpenSanctions team in cooperation with
[CORRECT!V](https://correctiv.org/) and [Lighthouse Reports](https://www.lighthousereports.nl/).
It is intended as a starting point for research into oligarch holdings, and a
benchmark against which sanctions in response to the invasion of Ukraine can
be evaluated.

While some of the entries are imported simply on the base of internet research,
the bulk of the list is sourced from existing lists of key Russian businesspeople
and political power brokers. It includes persons based on the following sources:

* [US Section 241 CAATSA Report](https://prod-upp-image-read.ft.com/40911a30-057c-11e8-9650-9c0ad2d7c5b5) from 2018 ([more info](https://home.treasury.gov/news/press-releases/sm0271))
* The [Navalny 35](/dataset/ru_navalny35/)
* Forbes List of Russian Billionaires, as of 2021
* Forbes List of Ukrainian Billionaires

publisher.name: OpenSanctions
publisher.description:
This list is sourced from multiple origins and constitutes original research
by OpenSanctions and media partners.

datasets.name: un_sc_sanctions
datasets.title: UN Security Council Consolidated Sanctions
datasets.summary: The Security Council's set of sanctions serve as the foundation for most national sanctions lists.
datasets.description:
The Security Council sanctions are developed by a set of committees, each
dedicated to establishing individual listings within its regime. Technical
explanations are available on the [download page](https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/content/un-sc-consolidated-list).

The UN SC web site describes the policy as follows:

> The Security Council can take action to maintain or restore international peace and security under Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter. Sanctions measures, under Article 41, encompass a broad range of enforcement options that do not involve the use of armed force. Since 1966, the Security Council has established 30 sanctions regimes, in Southern Rhodesia, South Africa, the former Yugoslavia (2), Haiti, Iraq (2), Angola, Rwanda, Sierra Leone, Somalia and Eritrea, Eritrea and Ethiopia, Liberia (3), DRC, Côte d’Ivoire, Sudan, Lebanon, DPRK, Iran, Libya (2), Guinea-Bissau, CAR, Yemen, South Sudan and Mali, as well as against ISIL (Da'esh) and Al-Qaida and the Taliban.
>
> Security Council sanctions have taken a number of different forms, in pursuit of a variety of goals. The measures have ranged from comprehensive economic and trade sanctions to more targeted measures such as arms embargoes, travel bans, and financial or commodity restrictions. The Security Council has applied sanctions to support peaceful transitions, deter non-constitutional changes, constrain terrorism, protect human rights and promote non-proliferation.
>
> Sanctions do not operate, succeed or fail in a vacuum. The measures are most effective at maintaining or restoring international peace and security when applied as part of a comprehensive strategy encompassing peacekeeping, peacebuilding and peacemaking. Contrary to the assumption that sanctions are punitive, many regimes are designed to support governments and regions working towards peaceful transition. The Libyan and Guinea-Bissau sanctions regimes all exemplify this approach.
>
> Today, there are 14 ongoing sanctions regimes which focus on supporting political settlement of conflicts, nuclear non-proliferation, and counter-terrorism. Each regime is administered by a sanctions committee chaired by a non-permanent member of the Security Council. There are 10 monitoring groups, teams and panels that support the work of 11 of the 14 sanctions committees.
>
> The Council applies sanctions with ever-increasing cognisance of the rights of those targeted. In the 2005 World Summit declaration, the General Assembly called on the Security Council, with the support of the Secretary-General, to ensure that fair and clear procedures are in place for the imposition and lifting of sanctions measures. The establishment of a focal point for de-listing, and the Office of the Ombudsperson to the ISIL (Da'esh) & Al-Qaida Sanctions Committee are examples of this approach in practice.

publisher.name: United Nations Security Council
publisher.description:
The Security Council is one of the principal organs of the United Nations, charged with
ensuring international peace and security. Its powers include establishing peacekeeping
operations, enacting international sanctions, and authorizing military action.

datasets.name: opencorporates
datasets.title: OpenCorporates
datasets.summary: The largest open database of company data in the world, with data from over 140 registries.
datasets.description:
OpenCorporates is a global database of companies, their directors and regulatory filings.

We provide links to OpenCorporates for entities that exist both in our database and in the
OpenCorporates database. These links can be used to explore more detail about sanctioned
companies. OpenCorporates customers with bulk data or API access can also use the
OpenCorporates URL to integrate both datasets, for example to build an in-house knowledge
graph with sanctions and company control information.

**Note:** as of May 2022, we have only linked some sanctioned companies to OpenCorporates.
In the future, we also hope to create links regarding directors and beneficial owners of
companies, for example in cases where the owner is a politicially exposed person (PEP).

publisher.name: OpenCorporates.com
publisher.description:
OpenCorporates, is the largest open database of company data in the world, with data
from over 140 registries.

datasets.name: fr_amf_regulatory_sanctions
datasets.title: France AMF Regulatory sanctions
datasets.summary: Decisions of the Sanctions Commission of the AMF (Autorité des marchés financiers).
datasets.description:
This dataset lists the decisions of the Sanctions Commission of the AMF (Autorité
des marchés financiers) in France. It includes information about the sanctions imposed
and the entities involved, with brief notes on the reasons for the sanctions. Detailed
reports are linked where available for more comprehensive information. The Sanctions
Commission is responsible for ensuring the compliance of market participants with the
financial regulations in France.

Detail of which entities were penalised and which were exonerated in a given case are
not available as structured data. Check linked reports to confirm decisions with respect
to matching entities.

publisher.name: Autorité des marchés financiers
publisher.description:
The Autorité des marchés financiers (AMF) is an independent public body responsible
for safeguarding investments in financial products, ensuring that investors receive
material information, and maintaining orderly financial markets. The AMF publishes
comprehensive information about its regulatory and supervisory activities, including
decisions of the Sanctions Commission, on its official website.

datasets.name: ie_unlawful_organizations
datasets.title: Ireland Unlawful Organisation (Suppression) Orders
datasets.summary: Orders from 1939 and 1983 in the Irish Statute Book, based on the Offences Against the State Act 1939
datasets.description:
This dataset includes the Unlawful Organisation (Suppression) Orders from 1939
and 1983 as published in the Irish Statute Book. These orders, issued  under
the authority of the Offences Against the State Act 1939, officially declare
specific organisations as unlawful due to their involvement in activities that
threaten public safety and order. The 1983 order designates the Irish National
Liberation Army (INLA) as an unlawful organisation, while the 1939 order 
targets the Irish Republican Army (IRA), also known as Oglaigh na héireann.
Both orders mandate the suppression of these organisations in the public interest.

publisher.name: electronic Irish Statute Book
publisher.description:
The electronic Irish Statute Book (eISB) includes Acts of the Oireachtas and
Statutory Instruments, the official versions of which remain the printed
versions published by Government Publications. It provides access to
legislative amendments, the Constitution, a selection of pre-1922 legislation,
and links to external legislation resources.

datasets.name: si_zvezoskop
datasets.title: Slovenian Political Officials from Zvezoskop
datasets.summary: Political office holders and their political career based on data presented at Zvezoskop (roughly translated as Relationscope)
datasets.description:
This dataset contains information verified by Oštro Center for investigative
journalism on recent and current political posts held by Slovenian political
officials as of 1 February 2024. Basic biographical information is also available.

The data was collected by Oštro, Center for investigative journalism in the
Adriatic region, based in Slovenia and published on [Zvezoskop](https://zvezoskop.si),
an interactive visualization of careers of government members, ministerial
secretaries and Members of Parliament.

The information on Zvezoskop spans from educational years to current political
roles, current and past positions or roles of political officials in other
organizations, institutions, or companies, an overview of all the politicians
associated with an entity and insight into the educational, professional, and
interest profiles of political parties represented in Government and the Parliament.

In addition to providing the public with information about career trajectories
of political officials, Zvezoskop also enables them to conduct independent
research and discover career intersections. It is also providing voters with
access to credible and verified information on careers to assist them in making
informed decisions. It may be used as a tool for journalists, NGOs, academics,
and other researchers conducting independent research into political careers
and networks.

publisher.name: Oštro
publisher.description:
Oštro is a non-profit center for investigative journalism, investigating
topics that are in the public interest for people in the Adriatic region
(Slovenia, Croatia, Italy) and the neighborhood.

datasets.name: us_fda_restricted
datasets.title: US FDA Clinical Investigator Disqualification Proceedings
datasets.summary: Clinical investigators who have been subject to disqualification proceedings regarding FDA-regulated clinical investations
datasets.description:
The FDA regulates clinical investigators who conduct studies intended to provide
evidence on the safety and effectiveness of investigational medical products.
Clinical investigators must follow applicable statutes and regulations to ensure
the integrity of clinical data and, for studies involving human subjects, to
protect their rights, safety, and welfare.

If the FDA determines that a clinical investigator has violated these requirements
— such as through data falsification or non-compliance — it may initiate a
disqualification proceeding.

This dataset lists investigators who have been subject to an administrative clinical
investigator disqualification action, and indicates the current status of that action.

publisher.name: US Food and Drug Administration
publisher.description:
The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is a federal agency under the Department of Health and Human
Services. It oversees the safety and effectiveness of a wide range of products, including food, drugs,
vaccines, medical devices, cosmetics, and veterinary items, as well as regulating tobacco and dietary supplements.

datasets.name: us_ms_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Mississippi Medicaid Terminated Provider List
datasets.summary: Service providers who have been terminated for cause from Mississippi's Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
> The Mississippi Division of Medicaid maintains a list of providers whose Medicaid provider agreement has
> been terminated. Refer to the Miss. Code Ann. §43-13-121 and the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR)
> §455.416 for the reasons a provider’s enrollment may be denied or revoked.

The following list contains individuals or entities whose participation in the
Medicaid program has been terminated for cause.

> Excluded individuals and entities are not allowed to receive reimbursement for
> providing Medicare and Medicaid services in any capacity, even if they are not
> on this listing.

[Provider Termination page](https://medicaid.ms.gov/providers/provider-terminations/)

publisher.name: Mississippi Division of Medicaid
publisher.description: > The Mississippi Division of Medicaid is a state and federal program created by the [Social Security Amendments of 1965 (PL 89-97)](http://www.socialsecurity.gov/OP_Home/comp2/F089-097.html), authorized by Title XIX of the Social Security Act to provide health coverage for eligible, low income populations.

datasets.name: ua_sfms_blacklist
datasets.title: Ukraine SFMS Blacklist
datasets.summary: Ukraine's financial intelligence unit publishes this list of sanctioned individuals.
datasets.description:
The Ukrainian sanctions list appaears to largely mirror the UN main list, but
does not retain a lot of the detail contained in the original list.

Title on their web site: "An up-to-date list of persons involved in terrorist
activities or subject to international sanctions" (Актуальний перелік осіб,
пов’язаних з провадженням терористичної діяльності або стосовно яких застосовано
міжнародні санкції)

A PDF version is [available here](https://fiu.gov.ua/assets/userfiles/Terror/BlackListFull.pdf).

publisher.name: State Finance Monitoring Service
publisher.description: The State Finance Monitoring Service (SFMS, Державна служба фінансового моніторингу України (Держфінмоніторинг) is a national center for receiving and analyzing reports of suspicious transactions and other information related to money laundering related to predicate offenses and terrorist financing, and to disseminate the results of this analysis.

datasets.name: md_interdictie
datasets.title: Moldovan Ban List of Economic Operators
datasets.summary: List of economic operators banned from participating public procurement in Moldova.
datasets.description:
The dataset contains a comprehensive list of economic operators that are prohibited
from participating in public procurement in the Republic of Moldova. It includes the
names of the companies, the reasons for prohibition, and the duration of the ban.

publisher.name: Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Moldova

datasets.name: ky_parliament
datasets.title: Cayman Islands Members of Parliament
datasets.summary: Current and recent Members of the Parliament of the Cayman Islands
datasets.description:
Members of the Parliament of the Cayman Islands as listed on the parliamentary
website.

Previous legislative terms are included from a [spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRM-hl1drkQMn4wHXxHkHXHZb2TkUyIFWxGXwJ_UqZNRpH00DGWrdHk_zDrHUsZ4YCeVYYojqSMmZuX/pub?output=csv)
extracted from Former Members pages.

publisher.name: Parliament of the Cayman Islands
publisher.description:
The House of Parliament of the Cayman Islands is a unicameral Legislature.
The Parliament of the Cayman Islands was previously known as the Legislative
Assembly of the Cayman Islands.

datasets.name: th_cabinet
datasets.title: Thailand Cabinet of Ministers
datasets.summary: List of the current members of the Thai Cabinet of Ministers.  It includes the names and official positions of each cabinet member.
datasets.description:
This dataset comprises information about the Thai Cabinet of Ministers. It includes 
the names of the ministers, their respective positions, and relevant details about 
their roles within the government

publisher.name: สำนักเลขาธิการคณะรัฐมนตรี
publisher.description: The Secretariat of the Cabinet of Thailand is responsible for coordinating and facilitating the implementation of government policies and actions as directed by the Cabinet. It acts as the main conduit for official communications from the Thai government.

datasets.name: fr_assemblee
datasets.title: French National Assembly
datasets.summary: Current and recent Members of the French National Assembly
datasets.description:
This dataset lists the members of the French National Assembly.

The data is collected from the open data platform for the National
Assembly (Assemblée Nationale), which is the lower legislative
chamber of the French Parliament.  The National Assembly is composed
of 577 members (députés) elected to five-year terms.

In contrast to the Senate, which represents the local and regional
governments (collectivités), the National Assembly represents the
people, and is elected by popular suffrage, by a two-round system in
single-member constituencies.  The number of constituencies is
proportional to the population, with the exception that each
département must have at least two representatives, and
constituencies may not cross departmental boundaries.

The function of the Parliament (including the Senate and the
National Assembly) is to examine and pass laws and to verify and
evaluate public policy and the functioning of the government.

publisher.name: National Assembly of France
publisher.description:
The National Assembly maintains an open data site publishing
information about its membership and functioning (including
committees, meetings, sessions, and votes), in XML, JSON, and CSV
format.

Data is provided under the French Government's [Open License](https://www.etalab.gouv.fr/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/ETALAB-Licence-Ouverte-v2.0.pdf)

datasets.name: interpol_red_notices
datasets.title: INTERPOL Red Notices
datasets.summary: International arrest warrants published by INTERPOL with a view to extradition of the wanted individuals.
datasets.description:
From the [INTERPOL site](https://www.interpol.int/en/How-we-work/Notices/Red-Notices):

> A Red Notice is a request to law enforcement worldwide to locate and
> provisionally arrest a person pending extradition, surrender, or similar
> legal action.
>
> It contains two main types of information:
> 
> Information to identify the wanted person, such as their name, date of
> birth, nationality, hair and eye colour, photographs and fingerprints
> if available.
> Information related to the crime they are wanted for, which can typically
> be murder, rape, child abuse or armed robbery. 
> Red Notices are published by INTERPOL at the request of a member country,
> and must comply with INTERPOL’s Constitution and Rules. A Red Notice is
> not an international arrest warrant.

datasets.name: jp_meti_eul
datasets.title: Japan METI End User List
datasets.summary: Sanctions imposed by Japan under its Foreign Exchange and Foreign Trade Law.
datasets.description:
> The Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) has issued the End User
> List, providing exporters with information on foreign entities for which
> concern cannot be eliminated regarding involvement in activities such as
