> the development of weapons of mass destruction (WMDs) and missiles, for
> the purpose of enhancing the effectiveness of the catch-all control on
> cargos and other loads relating to WMDs and missiles.

publisher.name: Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry
publisher.description:
METI’s mission is to develop Japan’s economy and industry by focusing on promoting
economic vitality in private companies and smoothly advancing external economic
relationships, and to secure stable and efficient supply of energy and mineral
resources.

datasets.name: us_wv_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US West Virginia Medicaid Provider Exclusions and Terminations
datasets.summary: Medicaid providers sanctioned in West Virginia's Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
The West Virginia Medicaid Management Information System maintains a list of providers
who have been terminated or excluded from the state Medicaid program. Providers listed
are not allowed to receive reimbursement for Medicaid services in any capacity.

publisher.name: Medicaid Management Information System
publisher.description:
The West Virginia Medicaid Management Information System (WVMMIS) is a computerized system that
processes and manages Medicaid claims and related data for the state of West Virginia.

datasets.name: ru_dossier_center_poi
datasets.title: Russian Persons of Interest published by Dossier Center
datasets.summary: People identified to be connected to crime at the Dossier Center
datasets.description:
This dataset publishes a list of possible organizers of the Kremlin organized crime group
and their probable accomplices with brief profiles.

This list is assembled by independent civil activists to map out the network of
influence of leadership in the Russian government connected to organized crime.

Their approach, translated from their website:

> We refer to investigations already conducted by journalists and civil activists,
> and we continue these investigations on our own and with the efforts of concerned
> citizens.
>
> The information we collect should serve as the basis for conducting an inspection
> by law enforcement agencies and subsequent initiation of criminal cases in Russia
> and abroad.

> We will be grateful for your help in replenishing and correcting the list, as well
> as in clarifying the facts and circumstances of the crimes committed and being
> committed by these persons.

publisher.name: Dossier Center
publisher.description:
The Dossier Center is a group of independent civil activists. Its goal is to promote
the formation of a rule of law state and civil society in Russia.

datasets.name: ph_most_wanted
datasets.title: Philippines Top Most Wanted Persons in the Cordillera Regions
datasets.summary: The dataset contains information about individuals currently most wanted by the Philippine National Police in the Cordillera Region.
datasets.description:
The dataset contains detailed information about individuals wanted by the police authorities in the Cordillera Region. It includes
various categories of criminals and terrorists. The dataset includes each person's
name, reward amount, offences, and case-control number (CC No.).

publisher.name: Philippine National Police
publisher.description:
The Cordillera Autonomous Region was established in 1987, leading to the creation of the Police Regional Office Cordillera,
which is responsible for maintaining peace and order in the Cordillera Region. The Philippine Constabulary was replaced by
the Philippine National Police in January 1991. Their main duty is to enforce the law, prevent and control crimes,
maintain peace and order, and ensure public safety and internal security with the active support of the community.

datasets.name: ky_judicial
datasets.title: Cayman Islands Senior Judicial Officers
datasets.summary: Judicial Officers from Cayman Islands Judicial Administration
datasets.description:
This lists senior judicial officers of the Cayman Islands judiciary.

From their website:

> The courts are an independent branch of government constitutionally
> entrusted with the administration of justice and the preservation
> of the rule of law and, in so doing, the protection of the rights and liberties
> guaranteed by the Constitution and laws of the Cayman Islands

publisher.name: Cayman Islands Judicial Administration
publisher.description:
"The Judiciary is one of three separate arms of Government. Its function
is to administer the law independently of the Executive and the Legislative
arms of Government; an independence that is safeguarded in the Constitution of
the Cayman Islands. The Judiciary is comprised of the following jurisdictions
in ascending order within the hierarchy of the courts: The Summary Court, The
Grand Court, Court of Appeal, Privy Council"

datasets.name: jp_mof_sanctions
datasets.title: Japan Economic Sanctions and List of Eligible People
datasets.summary: Sanctions imposed by Japan under its Foreign Exchange and Foreign Trade Law.
datasets.description:
> The Foreign Exchange Law is based on the free conduct of foreign transactions,
> but "when we recognize that it is necessary to fulfill our international commitments
> in good faith" and "we contribute to international efforts for international
> peace." "When we find it particularly necessary to do so" or "when a Cabinet decision
> is made to take countermeasures as it is particularly necessary to maintain Japan's
> peace and security", the competent minister (Minister of Finance and the Minister of
> Economy, Trade and Industry) The Minister) is supposed to be able to implement the
> required economic sanctions.
>
> Currently, as such economic sanctions, weapons bans on the Democratic Republic of
> Congo, such as the institutions of the former Iraqi administration, senior officials
> of the former Iraqi administration or their related persons, Tulliburn officials,
> terrorists, etc. Libya's Kadafi Revolutionary Leaders and their relationships, including
> those who violated, those involved in the inhibition of peace in Sudan, those involved
> in North Korea's missile or mass destruction weapons program, those who violated weapons
> bans against Somalia, etc. , Syrian President Al Assad and his associates, those who
> are judged to be directly involved in the "merger" of Crimea or the destabilization
> of eastern Ukraine, and those who were involved in acts that impair peace in the
> Central African Republic. Persons involved in activities that threaten peace in the
> Republic of Yemen, persons involved in acts that threaten peace in South Sudan, persons
> involved in nuclear activities in Iraq, and acts that threaten peace in the Republic
> of Syria. Asset freeze measures, etc. are being implemented for those involved
> in the above.

publisher.name: Ministry of Finance
publisher.description:
The Ministry of Finance (財務省) is the Japanese ministry that has
jurisdiction over ensuring sound finances, realizing fair taxation,
managing national treasury, managing customs operations, and
maintaining confidence in currency.

datasets.name: ch_parlament
datasets.title: Swiss Federal Assembly
datasets.summary: Current and recent Members of the Swiss Federal Assembly (Bundesversammlung)
datasets.description:
This dataset lists the members of the Swiss Federal Assembly.

The data is collected from the open data web services provided by the
Parliamentary Services of the Federal Assembly. The Federal Assembly is the
bicameral parliament of Switzerland, consisting of two chambers:

The **National Council** (Nationalrat/Conseil national/Consiglio nazionale)
is the lower chamber with 200 members elected by proportional representation
for four-year terms. Seats are distributed among the 26 cantons based on
population.

The **Council of States** (Ständerat/Conseil des États/Consiglio degli Stati)
is the upper chamber with 46 members representing the cantons (two per canton,
one per half-canton). Members are elected by their respective cantons for
four-year terms.

The Federal Assembly exercises legislative power, approves the federal budget,
elects the Federal Council (executive branch), and oversees the administration.
Both chambers have equal powers in legislation.

publisher.name: Parliamentary Services of the Federal Assembly
publisher.description:
The Swiss Parliament provides open access to parliamentary data through
web services at http://ws-old.parlament.ch/. The API offers comprehensive
information about parliamentarians, committees, legislative periods,
sessions, votes, and parliamentary affairs in multiple languages
(German, French, Italian, English).

datasets.name: us_mn_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Minnesota Health Care Programs Excluded Providers
datasets.summary: Medical providers suspended or terminated from Minnesota Health Care Programs.
datasets.description:
> The Minnesota Health Care Programs maintains and publishes lists of all
> individual or group providers suspended or terminated from receiving
> payment from Medicaid funds who MHCP has excluded. These lists are in
> addition to the federal exclusions list. Anyone who is on the list is
> excluded from employment with an entity to provide services to members
> for whom you will submit claims to MHCP for reimbursement to. MHCP will
> deny claims for services or items rendered, ordered, referred or
> prescribed by excluded providers.

publisher.name: Minnesota Health Care Programs
publisher.description: > Minnesota Health Care Programs (MHCP) provide health care coverage to eligible > families with children, adults, people with disabilities and seniors.

datasets.name: ext_kz_companies
datasets.title: Kazakhstan State Register of legal entities
datasets.summary: Enrichment of companies and other entities found in the Kazakhstan state register of legal entities.
datasets.description:
This dataset comprises companies and other types of entities from the
Kazakhstan state register of legal entities matched with
entities in the OpenSanctions database.

The information includes the full name of the company (including organization
form), one director, the current status, the BIN (might be absent for older companies)
a company profile according to General Classifier of Economic Activities, the
address, and the date of registration.

Information is available in Kazakh and Russian languages (except for the name
of the director, which is usually russian).

publisher.name: Ministry of Justice of the Republic of Kazakhstan
publisher.description:
The Ministry provides legal support for the activities of the state, supports
the rule of law in the work of state bodies, organizations, officials and citizens,
provides protection of the rights and legal interests of citizens and organizations.

datasets.name: us_dhs_uflpa
datasets.title: US UFLPA Entity List
datasets.summary: The US DHS publishes this list of entities wholly or in part using forced labour in the People's Republic of China, especially from the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region.
datasets.description:
> The Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act (Public Law No. 117-78), also known as 
> the UFLPA, directs the Forced Labor Enforcement Task Force to develop a strategy
> for supporting enforcement of the prohibition on the importation of goods into the
> United States manufactured wholly or in part with forced labor in the People's
> Republic of China, especially from the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, or Xinjiang.
>
> The UFLPA was enacted on December 23, 2021, with a June 21, 2022 effective date
> for a rebuttable presumption that goods mined, produced, or manufactured wholly or
> in part in Xinjiang or by an entity on the UFLPA Entity List are prohibited from
> U.S. importation under 19 U.S.C. § 1307.

\- [DHS](https://www.dhs.gov/uflpa)

publisher.name: Department of Homeland Security
publisher.description:
The Department of Homeland Security is the federal department responsible for public security,
including counter terrorism, border security, security of cyberspace and critical infrastructure,
and economic security.

datasets.name: cy_parliament
datasets.title: Cyprus House of Representatives
datasets.summary: Current members of the Cyprus House of Representatives (Βουλή των Αντιπροσώπων)
datasets.description:
Members of the Cyprus House of Representatives (Greek: Βουλή των Αντιπροσώπων,
Turkish: Temsilciler Meclisi), the unicameral legislative body of the Republic of Cyprus.

The House of Representatives consists of 80 members elected by proportional representation
for a five-year term. Seats are allocated across six electoral districts corresponding to
the administrative districts of Cyprus.

The data is sourced from the official website of the Cyprus House of Representatives,
containing biographical information for current members of parliament.

publisher.name: Cyprus House of Representatives
publisher.description:
The Cyprus House of Representatives provides information about its members on its
official website. The House exercises legislative power, approves the state budget,
and oversees the executive branch of government.

datasets.name: at_nbter_sanctions
datasets.title: Austrian National Bank Regulations on Terrorism Financing Restrictions
datasets.summary: Regulations aimed at combating terrorism through financial restrictions under the 2010 Sanctions Act.
datasets.description:
The dataset includes details about restricted assets for organizations and individuals as 
per the Austrian National Bank regulations DL 2/2002 and its 8th amendment, DL 1/2009, related 
to capital and payment traffic restrictions for combating terrorism. Please note that the source 
is manually curated and does not automatically update with changes to the official regulations.

publisher.name: Austrian National Bank
publisher.description:
The Oesterreichische Nationalbank (OeNB) is the central bank of the Republic of Austria 
and as such an integral part of the European System of Central Banks (ESCB). The OeNB 
contributes,  in the public interest, to monetary and economic policy decision-making in 
Austria and the euro area. Its core business areas are cash management, monetary policy, 
financial stability, statistics, and payments.
[Source: Official Website](hhttps://www.oenb.at/en/)

datasets.name: bg_jud_declarations
datasets.title: Bulgaria Judiciary Asset Declarations
datasets.summary: List of judges, prosecutors, and investigators in Bulgaria who are required to submit asset declarations.
datasets.description:
This dataset provides a list of judges, prosecutors, and investigators in Bulgaria with links
to their asset declarations.

Article 175 of the Judicial System Act (Закон за съдебната власт) outlines the requirements
and procedures for asset and interest declarations by judges, prosecutors, and investigators
in Bulgaria. These provisions require senior members of the judiciary to disclose their assets
and interests annually, with mandatory updates for significant changes. This process identifies
politically-exposed persons within Bulgaria's judiciary.
[Source: ЗАКОН ЗА СЪДЕБНАТА ВЛАСТ](https://www.justice.government.bg/home/normdoc/2135560660)

publisher.name: Инспекторат към Висшия съдебен съвет
publisher.name_en: Inspectorate to the Supreme Judicial Council
publisher.description:
The Inspectorate to the Supreme Judicial Council is an independent body within Bulgaria's
judiciary. Its primary function is to oversee the administrative activities of courts,
prosecutors, and investigative bodies without compromising their independence.

datasets.name: ext_abuja_mou_psc
datasets.title: Abuja MoU Port State Control Inspections
datasets.summary: Vessels inspected by member authorities under the Abuja MoU.
datasets.description:
This dataset contains ships inspected by port state control while visiting ports under
the jurisdiction of Abuja MoU member authorities. Each record includes, but is not limited
to, the ship's identity, flag, and associated company.

publisher.name: Abuja Memorandum of Understanding
publisher.description:
> The Memorandum of Understanding on Port State Control for West and Central African
> Region (Abuja MoU) is one of the 9 Regional MoUs and 1 National MoU established pursuant
> to IMO Resolution A.682(17) of 1991. Operating under a Cooperative Agreement with IMO,
> Abuja MoU was established as an inter-governmental organization comprising the Maritime
> Administrations of twenty-two Countries abutting the Atlantic Coast of Africa.

datasets.name: tr_parliament
datasets.title: Türkiye Grand National Assembly
datasets.summary: Current military members of the Grand National Assembly of Türkiye
datasets.description:
The Grand National Assembly of Turkey is the unicameral Turkish legislature.

It is the sole body given the legislative prerogatives by the Turkish Constitution.
There are 600 members of parliament (deputies) who are elected for a five-year term
from 87 electoral districts which represent the 81 administrative provinces of Turkey
(Istanbul and Ankara are divided into three electoral districts whereas
İzmir and Bursa are divided into two each because of its large populations).

publisher.name: Türkiye Büyük Millet Meclisi
publisher.description: Grand National Assembly of Türkiye

datasets.name: us_state_dept
datasets.title: US State Department Senior Officials
datasets.summary: Senior officials and diplomats in the US Department of State
datasets.description:
This is a dataset of senior officials in the US Department of State
including political appointees like the Secretary of State and Under
Secretaries of State, and senior administrative staff.

The State Department consists of bureaus and offices responsible for
handling various state interests and policy initiatives, each reporting to
a specific under secretary. A number of geographic bureaus and offices
report to and advise the Under Secretary for Political Affairs, and
guide the operation of the U.s. diplomatic missions within their regional
jurisdiction.

publisher.name: US State Department
publisher.description:
The U.S. State Department's stated mission is to protect and promote U.S. 
security, prosperity, and democratic values and shape an international
environment in which all Americans can thrive.

datasets.name: co_funcion_publica
datasets.title: Colombian PEP Declarations
datasets.summary: Declarations of Politically Exposed Person status of public servants and politicians in Colombia
datasets.description:
The Application for Public Integrity of the Administrative Department of
Public Service is a tool that allows citizens to consult the declarations
of assets, income and conflicts of interest of public servants and politicians
in Colombia.

The Colombian Decree 830 of 2021 aims to support the implementation of
article 52 of the United Nations Convention against Corruption as well as
guidance by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) and Latin American Financial Action Task
Force (GAFILAT). It therefore defines a relatively broad definition of PEPs
and requires the publication of declarations about persons holding these positions which have
the opportunity to influence public transactions for their benefit.

This dataset publishes the names, national ID numbers, and positions of public office
held by public servants in Colombia. We link to their Curriculim Vitae and asset declarations when available.
It currently excludes the contractor
information available at the same website.

We periodically supplement the data from the online search tool with their Excel download
which contains a little more information for a selection of people, although
the criteria for selection is unclear. While their Excel file data dictionary states that
currently-held positions will have a blank end date, that is not currently
the case so we include the stated end date but indicate occupancy status as unknown.

publisher.name: Deparatamento Administrativo del la Funcion Publica
publisher.description: The Colombian Administrative Department of Public Service

datasets.name: mx_deputies
datasets.title: Mexico Chamber of Deputies
datasets.summary: Current members of the Mexican lower house, the Chamber of Deputies
datasets.description:
This dataset comprises information about current deputies in Mexico who
represent the lower house of the Mexican Congress, known as the House of
Representatives.

It is constituted with a total of 500 seats. Of these, 300 "majority deputies"
are directly elected by plurality from single-member districts, the federal
electoral districts (with each state divided into at least two districts).
The remaining 200 "party deputies" are assigned through rules of proportional
representation. Each deputy serves a three-year term.

publisher.name: Cámara de Diputados
publisher.description: Mexico's Chamber of Deputies

datasets.name: de_bundestag
datasets.title: Germany Members of the Bundestag
datasets.summary: Current and recent Members of the German Federal Parliament; mostly teachers and lawyers
datasets.description:
Members of the German Bundestag (German: Deutscher Bundestag), the legislative body
of the Federal Republic of Germany.

Parties must receive at least 5% of the second votes nationwide or win 
three direct constituency seats to enter the Bundestag, with exceptions for parties
representing recognized national minorities. 

The data is sourced from the official open data provided by the German Bundestag
administration, containing comprehensive biographical and mandate information for
all current members.

publisher.name: German Bundestag
publisher.description:
The German Bundestag provides open data about its members on its official
website. The Bundestag exercises legislative power, elects the Chancellor, approves
the budget, and oversees the government.

datasets.name: jp_meti_ru
datasets.title: Japan METI Russian List
datasets.summary: Export and service restrictions to Russia, Belarus, and designated third-country entities  under Japan's Foreign Exchange and Foreign Trade Law.
datasets.description:
Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade, and Industry (METI) requires approval for certain 
exports and services to Russia, Belarus, and specified regions under the Foreign 
Exchange and Foreign Trade Law, with approvals generally denied except in limited cases. 
Restrictions apply to specific goods and technologies, as well as transactions involving 
designated entities.

publisher.name: Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry
publisher.description:
METI’s mission is to develop Japan’s economy and industry by focusing on promoting
economic vitality in private companies and smoothly advancing external economic
relationships, and to secure stable and efficient supply of energy and mineral
resources.

datasets.name: ps_local_freezing
datasets.title: Palestine Monetary Authority Local Freezing List
datasets.summary: People who are sanctioned by the PMA in accordance with Security Council  Resolutions to combat money laundering and the financing of terrorism.
datasets.description:
In line with authorities of the "Security Council Resolutions Enforcing Committee",
which formed according to Decree No. (14) of 2015 Concerning the Enforcement of
Security Council Resolutions, the PMA publishes a Local Freezing List.

Persons named on this list are prohibited from moving or transferring 
property, equipment, or other instrumentalities.

publisher.name: Palestine Monetary Authority
publisher.description:
The Palestine Monetary Authority is a public institution responsible
for the formulation and implementation of monetary and banking
policies in Palestine. The PMA operates by an act of the Palestine
Legislative Council's PMA Law Number (2) of 1997, which stipulated
the proper authority and autonomy of the PMA and the Banking Law Number 9 of 2010.

datasets.name: us_plum_book
datasets.title: US Periodically Listing Updates to Management (PLUM) Reporting
datasets.summary: The PLUM Reporting lists federal positions filled by political appointees, Schedule C employees, and other executives.
datasets.description:
This dataset lists the incumbents in the Periodically Listing Updates to Management (PLUM)
Reporting data by the U.S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM).

This covers positions submitted to the Plum Book published by the Senate Committee on
Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs and House Committee on Government Reform
alternately after each Presidential election, but is updated more frequently with
current incumbents.

> [The Plum Book] covers positions such as agency heads and their immediate subordinates, policy
> executives and advisors, and aides who report to these officials. The duties of many
> such positions may involve advocacy of Administration policies and programs and the
> incumbents usually have a close and confidential working relationship with the agency
> or other key officials.
>
> The major categories of positions listed in United States Government Policy and Supporting
> Positions include:
>
> * **Executive Schedule** and salary-equivalent positions paid at the rates established for
> levels I through V of the Executive Schedule;
> * **Senior Executive Service** "General" positions and **Senior Foreign Service** positions;
> * **Schedule C** positions excepted from the competitive service by the President, or by the
> Director, Office of Personnel Management, and other positions at the GS-14 and above level
> excepted from the competitive civil service by law, because of the confidential or
> policy-determining nature of the position duties.

[Source: GovInfo](https://www.govinfo.gov/collection/plum-book?path=/GPO/United%20States%20Government%20Policy%20and%20Supporting%20Positions%20%2528Plum%20Book%2529)

publisher.name: U.S. Office of Personnel Management
publisher.description: The U.S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM) serves as the chief human resources agency and personnel policy manager for the Federal Government. [Source: Official Website](https://www.opm.gov/about-us/)

datasets.name: ext_ee_ariregister
datasets.title: Estonia e-Business Register (E-äriregister)
datasets.summary: Companies registered in Estonia, including directors and beneficial owners which match entities in the OpenSanctions database.

publisher.name: Registrite ja Infosüsteemide Keskus
publisher.name_en: Centre of Registers and Information Systems
publisher.description:
The e-Business Register issues free legal and statistical data about all
Estonian companies, non-profit associations, foundations, state and local
governmental agencies and self-employed persons.

datasets.name: us_de_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Delaware Medicaid Sanctioned Providers
datasets.summary: List of providers excluded from participating in the Delaware Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
This dataset provides details on health care providers who have been excluded from
participation in the Delaware Medicaid program. It lists provider names, identifiers
such as NPI and License numbers, as well as the authority, duration, and nature of
the sanction.

These sanctions result from findings of fraud, abuse, or violations of Medicaid
policies. The dataset covers a range of sanctions, from temporary suspensions
to permanent terminations, and includes details on providers' reinstatement
statuses when applicable.

publisher.name: Delaware Health and Social Services
publisher.description:
The Delaware Health and Social Services is a state agency dedicated to providing a wide range
of essential programs and services for the residents of Delaware. Its responsibilities include
managing Social Support initiatives, delivering comprehensive Health Care Services, and
addressing Substance Abuse and Mental Health needs.

datasets.name: nl_most_wanted
datasets.title: Netherlands Police Nationale Opsporingslijst
datasets.summary: The most wanted persons are suspected of serious crimes and are ranked high on the police's hit list.
datasets.description:
From the dutch police page [politie](https://www.politie.nl/en/wanted-and-missing/most-wanted):

> The most wanted persons are suspected of serious crimes and are ranked high on the
> police's hit list.

publisher.name: Korps Nationale Politie
publisher.description: The list is composed by Korps Nationale Politie.

datasets.name: un_ga_protocol
datasets.title: UN Heads of State, Heads of Government and Ministers for Foreign Affairs
datasets.summary: The UN's list of senior government officials in all of its member states.
datasets.description:
> The Protocol and Liaison Service maintains a list of Heads of State, Heads
> of Government, and Ministers for Foreign Affairs of all Member States
> based on the information provided by the Permanent Missions.

**Note:** This crawler uses an LLM-based approach to extract the data from
the PDF file. We are still working on improving the quality of that process
in order to ensure the highest possible accuracy.

publisher.name: United Nations Protocol Service
publisher.description:
The Protocol and Liaison Service within the Department for General Assembly
and Conference Management (DGACM) serves the protocol needs of the
Secretariat, including those of the Secretary-General, the Deputy
Secretary-General and the President of the General Assembly.

datasets.name: ebrd_ineligible
datasets.title: EBRD Ineligible Entities
datasets.summary: Entities that have been declared ineligible to become EBRD counterparties due to fraud, corruption, collusion, or other prohibited practices.
datasets.description:
This dataset lists entities and individuals that are ineligible to participate in
EBRD-financed projects. It includes detailed information such as the firm names,
addresses, periods of ineligibility, and the specific prohibited practices they were
involved in (e.g., fraud, corruption, collusion). The EBRD presents several separate
tables of ineligble entities, including one with cross-debarred entities, those originated
within EBRD, and sanctions resulting from third-party finding. It's unclear if these
overlap.

publisher.name: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
publisher.description:
Founded in 1991, the EBRD provides project financing mainly for private enterprises,
usually together with other commercial lending partners, in countries that are committed
to, and apply, democratic principles. It also works with public partners to support
privatisation, restructuring and improvement of municipal services. It does this by
financing investments, providing business services and getting involved in high-level
policy dialogue in these countries to support private sector development.
[Source](https://economy-finance.ec.europa.eu/investment-support/coordination-european-financial-institutions/coordination-european-bank-reconstruction-and-development_en)

datasets.name: us_dc_exclusions
datasets.title: US Washington DC Excluded Parties List
datasets.summary: List of individuals and entities excluded from doing business with the District of Columbia government, including but not limited to the Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
The Excluded Parties List identifies individuals and entities that have been suspended or debarred
from doing business with the District of Columbia. While listed, these parties are ineligible to
receive contract awards, renewals, subcontracts, or participate in District government programs,
including Medicaid.

publisher.name: DC Office of Contracting and Procurement
publisher.description:
The DC Office of Contracting and Procurement (OCP) manages the acquisition of goods, services,
and construction for the District of Columbia government. OCP is also responsible for overseeing
contractor eligibility, including the suspension and debarment of individuals and entities through
the Excluded Parties List.

datasets.name: enforcement
datasets.title: Enforcement Actions and Regulatory Notices
datasets.summary: Entities involved in enforcement actions and regulatory notices.
datasets.description:
This collection combines data from enforcement actions and regulatory notices
across various jurisdictions and agencies. US federal agencies make up a
significant portion of the collection.

datasets.name: is_althingi
datasets.title: Iceland parliament
datasets.summary: Members of the Iceland parliament, known as the Althingi
datasets.description:
This dataset comprises information about current members of the Althingi,
which is the supreme national parliament of Iceland. The unicameral
parliament has 63 members, and is elected every four years based on
party-list proportional representation. The constitution of Iceland
provides for six electoral constituencies with the possibility of an
increase to seven. The constituency boundaries and the number of seats
allocated to each constituency are fixed by legislation

publisher.name: Alþingi
publisher.description: The parliament of Iceland

datasets.name: us_pa_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Pennsylvania Medicheck list
datasets.summary: Medical providers who are precluded from participation in the Medical Assistance Program
datasets.description:
The Medicheck List dataset contains information about providers
who are excluded from participating in the Medical Assistance (MA) Program. Healthcare
providers are required by law to screen all employees, contractors, and entities against
this list at the time of hire or contracting and perform monthly checks thereafter.

publisher.name: Department of Human Services
publisher.description: The Pennsylvania Department of Human Services (DHS) is a state agency responsible for providing essential services and support to individuals and families in need, including healthcare, child welfare, and social assistance programs.

datasets.name: kg_fiu_national
datasets.title: Kyrgyz National List
datasets.summary: A simple list of sanctioned individuals and entities published by the Kyrgyz' State Financial Intelligence Service.
datasets.description:
Published by the State Financial Intelligence Service (the Financial Intelligence
Unit - FIU) under the Cabinet of Ministers of Kyrgyzstan. The list is minimalistic 
and has limited quality.

datasets.name: ar_parliament
datasets.title: Argentina Members of Parliament
datasets.summary: Current and recent members of the Argentine Chamber of Deputies, the lower house of the National Congress.
datasets.description:
National Deputies (Members of the Parliament) - Representatives elected directly
by the people of the provinces and the city of Buenos Aires of Argentina. The
chamber of deputies is one of two houses of parliament in Argentina.

publisher.name: Honorable Cámara de Diputados de la Nación Argentina
publisher.description: The Honorable Chamber of Deputies of Argentina

datasets.name: us_hi_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Hawaii Medicaid Exclusions and Reinstatements
datasets.summary: Medical providers excluded from Hawaii's Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
The State of Hawai'i Department of Human Services maintains a list of providers
who have been excluded from the state program.

 > An excluded provider is an individual or entity that is not allowed to receive
 > reimbursement for providing Medicare and Medicaid services in any capacity,
 > even if they are not on this listing by the Med-QUEST Division.

 > Excluded individuals and entities are listed according to the type of provider
 > they were at the time of exclusion; however, they are excluded from
 > participating in providing services in the Medicaid program in all categories
 > of service and in any capacity.

 > Any provider participating or applying to participate in the Medicaid program
 > must search Hawaiʻi’s excluded provider list monthly and the List of Excluded
 > Individuals and Entities (LEIE) on an annual basis to determine if any existing
 > employee or contractor has been excluded from participation in the Medicaid
 > program. In addition, any provider participating or applying to participate in
 > the Medicaid program must search both lists prior to hiring staff to ensure
 > that any potential employees or contractors have not been excluded from
 > participating in the Medicaid program.

publisher.name: Hawai'i Department of Human Services, Med-QUEST Division
publisher.description:
The Med-QUEST Division's stated mission is to

> empower Hawai'i’s residents to improve and sustain wellbeing by developing,
> promoting and administering innovative and high-quality healthcare programs with aloha

datasets.name: special_interest
datasets.title: Special Interest Watchlists
datasets.summary: Topical datasets from civil society organizations, investigative journalists, and other sources that track individuals and entities of special interest.
datasets.description:
This collection contains datasets that provide contextual details and more in-depth
analysis of entities that are of special interest to the public.

datasets.name: us_sam_exclusions
datasets.title: US SAM Procurement Exclusions
datasets.summary: A database of suppliers who have been excluded from participating in US federal procurement.
datasets.description:
> This data package is refreshed daily and contains the publicly available data for
> all active exclusion records entered by the Federal government identifying those
> parties excluded from receiving Federal contracts, certain subcontracts, and certain
> types of Federal financial and non-financial assistance and benefits. This version
> of the file has the Unique Entity Identifier fields added. Users must read the
> exclusion record completely to understand how it impacts the excluded party. The
> links include the three-digit Julian date for easier identification of the most
> recent file.

publisher.name: General Services Administration
publisher.description: GSA's acquisition solutions offer private sector professional services, equipment, supplies, and IT to government organizations and the military. GSA also promotes management best practices and efficient government operations through the development of governmentwide policies

datasets.name: us_klepto_hr_visa
datasets.title: US Anti-Kleptocracy and Human Rights Visa Restrictions
datasets.summary: US Visa restrictions on officials of foreign governments and family members credibly implicated in corruption or human rights violations
datasets.description:
The U.S. Department of State Bureau of International Narcotics and Law 
Enforcement Affairs publishes this report of quarterly submissions
to congress as per Section 7031(c)(1)(A) of the Department of State,
Foreign Operations and Related Appropriations Act of 2021

From the report pages:

> Officials of foreign governments and their immediate family members about
> whom the Secretary of State has credible information have been involved,
> directly or indirectly, in significant corruption, including corruption
> related to the extraction of natural resources, or a gross violation of
> human rights, including the wrongful detention of locally employed staff
> of a United States diplomatic mission or a United States citizen or national,
> shall be ineligible for entry into the United States.

publisher.name: US State Department
publisher.description:
The U.S. State Department's stated mission is to protect and promote U.S. 
security, prosperity, and democratic values and shape an international
environment in which all Americans can thrive.

datasets.name: es_mayors_councillors
datasets.title: Spain Mayors and Councillors
datasets.summary: Individuals holding mayoral or municipal councillor positions in Spain.
datasets.description:
This dataset contains information on individuals currently serving as mayors or councillors 
in Spanish municipalities. It includes their names, roles, political affiliations, and 
relevant administrative details. The dataset reflects current officeholders and includes 
historical data from the 2019–2023 municipal term.

publisher.name: Ministerio de Política Territorial y Memoria Democrática
publisher.name_en: Ministry of Territorial Policy and Democratic Memory
publisher.description:
The Ministry of Territorial Policy and Democratic Memory is the government department 
responsible for proposing and executing policy on relations and cooperation with 
autonomous communities and local administrations.

datasets.name: au_listed_terrorist_orgs
datasets.title: Australia Listed Terrorist Organisations
datasets.summary: Australia's list of terrorist organisations as listed under the Criminal Code Act 1995
datasets.description:
Under Australia's Criminal Code Act 1995, the Attorney-General may list an organisation as a terrorist organisation if they are satisfied on reasonable grounds that the organisation is directly or indirectly engaged in, preparing, planning, assisting in or fostering the doing of a terrorist act.

There are two ways in which an organisation is identified as a terrorist organisation:

1. By being specified by name in the regulations (a listed terrorist organisation); or
2. By being an organisation that is directly or indirectly engaged in, preparing, planning, assisting in or fostering the doing of a terrorist act whether or not the terrorist act occurs (an unlisted terrorist organisation).

As of recent legislative changes, regulations listing terrorist organisations continue indefinitely, rather than ceasing to have effect after three years.

publisher.name: Department of Home Affairs
publisher.description: The Department of Home Affairs brings together Australia's federal law enforcement, national and transport security, criminal justice, emergency management, multicultural affairs, settlement services and immigration and border-related functions, working together to keep Australia safe.

datasets.name: eu_sanctions_map
datasets.title: EU Sanctions Map
datasets.summary: The EU Sanctions Map is a visualisation of EU sanctions policy. It includes a broader set of policies and entities than the EU consolidated sanctions list.
datasets.description:
The EU Sanctions Map web site mostly includes the same data as the
[EU Consolidated List](/datasets/eu_fsf/), which is not repeated here. However, certain
EU sanction types (which do not involve asset freezes) are not included in the main list,
but featured on the Sanctions Map.

> The EU Sanctions Map provides information on restrictive measures (sanctions) adopted
> by the European Union - either to transpose measures imposed by the United Nations
> Security Council or autonomously. The EU Sanctions Map does not provide information on
> national sanctions of the EU Member States or any other sanctions imposed by third states.

Explanation of the EC regarding the scope difference with the EU FSF:

> The Consolidated Financial Sanctions List only includes persons, groups and entities
> subject, under EU restrictive measures (sanctions), to an asset freeze and the
> prohibition to make funds and economic resources available to them.

> Entities contained in Annex IV of Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014 are subject to
> specific economic prohibitions as referred to in Article 2(7), 2a(7) and 2b(1) of
> Regulation (EU) No 833/2014. They are, however, not subject to an asset freeze, hence
> not included in the Consolidated list.

publisher.name: Council of the European Union
publisher.description: The Sanctions Map was created by the Estonian Presidency of the EU in 2017.

datasets.name: my_investor_alert_list
datasets.title: Malaysia Securities Commission Investor Alert List
datasets.summary: Individuals and entities provide investment services without registration with the Malaysia Securities Commission.
datasets.description:
This list contains the names of entities and individuals providing investment services
despite not being registered with, and authorised to do so by Malaysia Securities
Commission.

Some entities in this list may impersonate legitimate entities which
are described as “potential clone”.

publisher.name: Suruhanjaya Sekuriti Malaysia
publisher.description:
The Securities Commission Malaysia is a Malaysian statutory body with
responsibility for the development and regulation of capital markets
in the country.

datasets.name: br_pep
datasets.title: Brazil Politically Exposed Persons
datasets.summary: This datasets encompass brazilian PEPs divulgated by the CGU
datasets.description:
This registry is presented in an open format and sourced from various sectors/entities of the Public Administration.
Key sources include the Federal Court of Accounts (TCU),
the Federal Chamber (Câmara Federal), the Federal Senate (Senado Federal),
the Ministry of Economy, the Office of the Comptroller General (CGU),
and other relevant entities.
It lists public agents who currently hold or
have held significant public offices, jobs, 
or functions within the last five years.

publisher.name: General Control Office of the Union

datasets.name: kp_rusi_reports
datasets.title: DPRK Reports
datasets.summary: A database of entities and events related to North Korea's sanctions evasion efforts.
datasets.description:
> The DPRK Reports database contains structured information relating to the
> activities of entities that assist North Korea to develop prohibited
> weapons programmes and evade sanctions. The data is sourced from the
> United Nations Panel of Experts reports, from 2010 to 2023, as well as
> the associated UN sanctions resolutions.

> It includes profiles of the persons, companies, organizations, and vessels
> that are mentioned in the reports, and contains information such as
> names, aliases, locations, contact details and sanction designation
> status. The database also records the relationships between entities
> and their involvement or relationship to specific events.

> The objective of this database is to provide national authorities and
> private-sector institutions with information that can assist with
> sanctions implementation efforts such as due diligence and compliance.

The original data contains a rich set of source documents which we've
excluded from the entity network we've imported into OpenSanctions.

publisher.name: Korea Risk Group at RUSI
publisher.description:
Korea Risk Group provides primary and secondary data on North Korea
that is unavailable anywhere else, and a host to research tools
tailored for users within government, business, academia and journalism.
It is hosted by the Royal United Services Institute (RUSI) in London.

datasets.name: mc_fund_freezes
datasets.title: Monaco National Fund Freezing List
datasets.summary: A list of entities subject to fund and economic resource freezing procedures.
datasets.description:
This dataset publishes a national list of individuals and entities subject to the freezing of funds and economic resources
in the Principality as mandated by the Sovereign Ordinance No. 8,664 of May 26, 2021.

This list is managed and regularly updated by the Budget and Treasury Department. It aligns with those established
by the United Nations, the European Union, France and also includes designations made by the Minister of State under UN
Security Council Resolution 1373 (2001).

Updates to the list are published via ministerial decisions.
[Read More](https://geldefonds.gouv.mc/a-propos-de-la-liste-nationale-de-gel-des-fonds)

publisher.name: La Principauté de Monaco
publisher.description: Official Monaco Government

datasets.name: us_bis_oac
datasets.title: US Office of Antiboycott Compliance Requester List
datasets.summary: Entities reported for making boycott-related requests in U.S. transactions
datasets.description:
The antiboycott provisions of the Export Administration Regulations (EAR) encourage,
and in specified cases, require U.S. persons to refuse to participate in unsanctioned
foreign boycotts. They have  the effect of preventing U.S. persons from advancing foreign
policies of other  nations that run counter to U.S. policy.

These entities have been reported to the BIS for making boycott-related requests in U.S. transactions.
The list is updated quarterly and is not exhaustive.

Related dataset: [US BIS Alleged Antiboycott Violations](https://www.opensanctions.org/datasets/us_bis_antiboycott/) contains U.S. companies alleged to have
violated antiboycott regulations by complying with such requests (the violators),
while this dataset contains the foreign entities that made the requests
(the requesters).

publisher.name: Bureau of Industry and Security
publisher.description:
BIS, part of the U.S. Department of Commerce, manages the intersection of business and
U.S. foreign policy and security interests. The Office of Antiboycott Compliance (OAC)
within BIS enforces the Anti-Boycott Act of 2018, which discourages and sometimes
prohibits U.S. companies from supporting unsanctioned foreign boycotts.

datasets.name: kz_afmrk_sanctions
datasets.title: Kazakh Terrorist and Terror Financing lists
datasets.summary: A combination of two lists of sanctioned individuals and entities published by the Financial Monitoring Agency of Kazakhstan.
datasets.description:
The terror financing entities are included in accordance with Article 12 of the Law of the Republic of Kazakhstan "On
Counteracting Legalization (Laundering) of Criminally Obtained Incomes and
Financing of Terrorism", the list of organizations and persons associated
with the financing of terrorism and extremism is published.

Some, if not all persons listed for participation in terrorism are by request of other countries.

publisher.name: Қазақстан Республикасының Қаржылық мониторинг агенттігі
publisher.description:
Financial Monitoring Agency of the Republic of Kazakhstan is a state body directly
subordinate and accountable to the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan, which
provides guidance in the field of countering the legalization (laundering) of
proceeds from crime and the financing of terrorism, as well as for the prevention,
detection, suppression, disclosure and investigation of economic and financial
offenses referred to the jurisdiction of this body by the legislation of the
Republic of Kazakhstan.

datasets.deprecation:
This data is no longer accessible from the official source. An API key is now required for
access, which is only available to organisations registered in Kazakhstan.
[Correspondence with the Financial Monitoring Agency of the Republic of Kazakhstan](https://github.com/opensanctions/opensanctions/issues/2825#issuecomment-3718456164)
for broader access to this data has not been successful. The dataset is therefore
now deprecated. It will be removed on 2026-03-31.

datasets.name: ext_ua_edr
datasets.title: Ukraine Consolidated State Registry
datasets.summary: The beneficial ownership database of legal entities registered in Ukraine (EDR)
datasets.description:
Publication of this data has been suspended since the Russian attack on Feburary
24, 2022. We're not linking to the full dataset here, either, but instead include
details on those Ukrainian companies identified by the Ukraine National Security
Council on its sanctions list.

> Beneficial ownership data in Ukraine has been publicly available as
> open data in the Unified State Register of Legal Entities and
> Individual Entrepreneurs (USR) since 2017.

> Ukrainian law refers to ‘controllers’ (контролери) as opposed to
> ‘founders’ (засновниками) to differentiate beneficial ownership from
> legal ownership/shareholding. ‘Founders’ can be legal entities or
> natural persons.

> A beneficial owner of a legal entity is a natural person who directly
> or indirectly:

> * Has the right to execute decisive influence on the management or
>   economic activity of a legal entity
> * Has decisive influence on the composition and decisions of the entity’s managing body
> * Has at least 25% of shares or voting rights of the entity
> * Nominees and agents of such rights cannot be named as beneficial owners.

cf. https://register.openownership.org/data_sources/ua-edr-register

publisher.name: Ministry of Justice of Ukraine
publisher.description:
The database is managed and - in peacetime - published by the Department
for State Registration and Notariat.

datasets.name: za_fic_sanctions
datasets.title: South Africa Targeted Financial Sanctions
datasets.summary: The South African FIC sanctions list, largely based on UN Security Council sanctions.
datasets.description:
South African sanctions are largely based on the [UN Security Council sanctions
list](/datasets/un_sc_sanctions/), with some additions.

> Sanctions impose restrictions on activities that relate to particular countries,
> goods and services, or persons and entities. Targeted Financial Sanctions (TFS)
> measures generally restrict sanctioned persons and entities from having access
> to funds and property under their control and from receiving financial services
> in relation to such funds and property.  In order for these sanctions to be given
> effect, the FIC Act requires Accountable Institutions to freeze property and
> transactions pursuant to financial sanctions imposed in the United Nations
> Security Council Resolutions.

publisher.name: Financial Intelligence Centre
publisher.description:
The Financial Intelligence Centre (FIC) exists to apply measures outlined in
the Financial Intelligence Centre Act, 2001 (Act 38 of 2001), which are
intended to make the financial system intolerant to abuse. The FIC does this
by working towards fulfilling its mandate of assisting in identifying the
proceeds of crime, combating money laundering, the financing of terrorism
and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.

datasets.name: ps_ohchr_settlement
datasets.title: OHCHR List of Companies Linked to Illegal Settlement in the West Bank
datasets.summary: Database of business enterprises involved in illegal settlement activity in the Occupied Palestinian Territory, including East Jerusalem.
datasets.description:
Following resolution 31/36 of the United Nations Human Rights
Council, adopted on 24 March 2016, the United Nations Office of the
High Commissioner for Human Rights maintains a database of business
enterprises involved in a specific set of activities supporting
illegal settlement activity in the West Bank, including East
Jerusalem.

Businesses named may be implicated in one or more of the 10
activites listed in the resolution, which are:

a. The supply of equipment and materials facilitating the
construction and the expansion of settlements and the wall, and
associated infrastructure;

b. The supply of surveillance and identification equipment for
settlements, the wall and checkpoints directly linked with
settlements;

c. The supply of equipment for the demolition of housing and
property, the destruction of agricultural farms, greenhouses, olive
groves and crops;

d. The supply of security services, equipment and materials to
enterprises operating in settlements;

e. The provision of services and utilities supporting the
maintenance and existence of settlements, including transport;

f. Banking and financial operations helping to develop, expand or
maintain settlements and their activities, including loans for
housing and the development of businesses;

g. The use of natural resources, in particular water and land, for
business purposes;

h. Pollution, and the dumping of waste in or its transfer to
Palestinian villages;

i. Captivity of the Palestinian financial and economic markets, as
well as practices that disadvantage Palestinian enterprises,
including through restrictions on movement, administrative and legal
constraints;

j. The use of benefits and reinvestments of enterprises owned
totally or partially by settlers for developing, expanding and
maintaining the settlements.

publisher.name: United Nations Human Rights Council
publisher.description: > The Human Rights Council is an intergovernmental body within the United Nations system made up of 47 States responsible for the promotion and protection of all human rights around the globe.

> Activities 2001 [Act 613]. Under section 66B (1) of the Act 613,
>
> Where the Minister of Home Affairs is satisfied on information given to him by
> a police officer that:

datasets.name: us_al_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Alabama Medicaid Suspended Providers
datasets.summary: Medical providers excluded from Alabama's Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
This dataset contains information about individuals and entities that
have been excluded from Alabama's Medicaid Program. According to
their website:

> Excluded Individuals and Entities are not allowed to receive
> reimbursement for providing Medicare and Medicaid services in any
> capacity, even if they are not on this listing by the Alabama Medicaid Agency.
>
> Excluded individuals and entities are listed according to the type
> of provider they were at the time of exclusion; however, they are
> excluded from participating in providing services in the Medicaid
> program in all categories of service and in any capacity. The exclusion
> remains in effect until they are removed from this list.
>
> Any provider participating or applying to participate in the Medicaid
> program must search Medicaid's Exclusion List, the List of Excluded
> Individuals and Entities (LEIE), and the System for Award Management
> (SAM) website on a monthly basis to determine if any existing employee
> or contractor has been excluded from participation in the Medicaid program.
> Also, any provider participating or applying to participate in the Medicaid
> program must search all three lists prior to hiring staff to ensure that
> any potential employees or contractors have not been excluded from participating
> in the Medicaid program.

publisher.name: Alabama Medicaid
publisher.description:
Alabama Medicaid is a state program that provides medical and health-related
services to eligible low-income individuals and families in Alabama.

datasets.description:
The Inspector General of Financial Information in the Polish Ministry of Finance
issues sanctions such that obligated institutions apply restrictive measures
in accordance with Article 118 Section 1 point 1 of the Act of March 1, 2018 on
countering money laundering and terrorist financing.

These sanctions comprise of a small list issued by the Polish Ministry of Finance,
as well as the lists referred to in point 3 of resolution 2253 (2015)
of the United Nations Security Council and point 1 of resolution 1988 (2011) of
the United Nations Security Council United Nations (UN SC).

This dataset includes minimal data from the UN lists, whose data is included in
full in the [UN SC Consolidated Dataset](https://www.opensanctions.org/datasets/un_sc_sanctions/)
and our [Standard collection of datasets](https://www.opensanctions.org/datasets/default/)

datasets.name: ng_join_dots
datasets.title: Nigeria Joining the Dots PEPs and PEP Relatives
datasets.summary: Data on Politically Exposed Persons in Nigeria and their relatives from the Joining the Dots project.
datasets.description:
This is a dataset of Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) in Nigeria and their relatives,
as part of the Joining the Dots project.

This is a civil-society project using official sources as far as possible,
complemented by other public sources. It aims to improve natural resource governance in Nigeria
by enabling the discovery of relationships between people in political office
and companies in the extractives industry.

The Joining the Dots Nigeria project also publishes a dataset of companies in the
extractives industry and their beneficial owners. It further lists
[possible name matches between these beneficial owners and PEPs](https://peps.directoriolegislativo.org/nigeria/monitoring)
and their relatives.

However, these matches have not yet been confirmed due to the lack of strong
identifiers in the available data. This dataset therefore currently only includes the
PEPs and their relatives, but not the companies or ownership information.

publisher.name: Directorio Legislativo/EITI
publisher.description:
This is a project by [Directorio Legislativo](https://directoriolegislativo.org/en/) with support from
the Opening Extractives program ([OpenOwnership](https://www.openownership.org/en/) and [EITI](https://eiti.org/))
and the [Nigeria Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (NEITI)](https://www.neiti.gov.ng/).

datasets.name: br_ceis

datasets.summary: The National Register of Ineligible and Suspended Companies (CEIS) lists individuals and companies sanctioned from public procurement in Brazil.
datasets.description:
The CEIS is an essential part of Brazil's Portal da Transparência,
providing a comprehensive list of individuals and companies that have faced sanctions restricting
their ability to participate in public tenders or contract with the public administration.
These sanctions include temporary suspension, declaration of ineligibility,
and other penalties under various Brazilian laws like the Bidding Law and the Anti-Corruption Law.

The CEIS not only promotes transparency for citizens but also serves
as a crucial reference for public managers in governmental procurement processes,
ensuring compliance at all federal levels.

The database is maintained under the mandate of the Anti-Corruption Law (Law No. 12.846/2013),
with the entries being directly fed by public entities responsible for the sanctions.

datasets.name: ca_commons
datasets.title: Canada Members of the House of Commons
datasets.summary: Current Members of the Canadian lower chamber, the House of Commons
datasets.description:
The members list is collected from the open data platform provided by the
House of Commons of Canada. The House of Commons is the lower chamber
of Canada's bicameral Parliament, alongside the Senate.

The House of Commons consists of 338 members, each representing a
single electoral district (also known as a riding or constituency).
Members of Parliament (MPs) are elected by plurality in their districts,
typically for a term of up to four years, though elections may be called
earlier. Electoral boundaries are reviewed and adjusted following each
decennial census to reflect population changes.

The House of Commons is responsible for introducing and passing legislation,
holding the government accountable through Question Period and committee work,
and representing the interests of Canadians. The Prime Minister and most
Cabinet ministers are typically members of the House of Commons.

publisher.name: House of Commons of Canada
publisher.description:
The House of Commons provides open data about current Members of Parliament
through its Open Data portal. The data is available in XML format and includes
information about each member's honorific title, name, constituency,
province/territory, political party affiliation, election date, and mandate
end date.

datasets.name: tr_fcib
datasets.title: Türkiye Asset Freezing Sanctions List (MASAK)
datasets.summary: Individuals, entities, and organizations whose assets are frozen by the Republic of Türkiye based on United Nations Security Council resolutions, requests from foreign countries, domestic decisions, and efforts to counter the financing of proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.
datasets.description:
The asset freezing decisions published by the Republic of Türkiye include comprehensive
lists of individuals, entities, and organizations subject to financial sanctions. These
sanctions are implemented under the following categories:
sanctions are implemented under the following categories:

- United Nations Security Council Resolutions: Asset freezes pursuant to Article 5 of
  Law No. 6415, targeting individuals and entities designated under UNSC resolutions.
- Requests from Foreign Countries: Asset freezes pursuant to Article 6 of Law No. 6415,
  targeting individuals and entities based on requests made by foreign governments.
- Domestic Freezing Decisions: Asset freezes pursuant to Article 7 of Law No. 6415,
  targeting individuals and entities through domestic legal actions and decisions.
- Countering Financing of Proliferation of Mass-Destruction Weapons: Asset freezes within
  the scope of Articles 3.A and 3.B of Law No. 7262, aimed at preventing the financing of
  proliferation of weapons of mass destruction

datasets.name: maritime
datasets.title: Maritime-related sanctions
datasets.summary: A shipping-focussed data subset for screening vessels, operators and owners against sanctions.
datasets.description:
This collection contains maritime-related sanctions data, featuring vessels, and organizations
linked to them. The dataset includes all watchlists that are relevant to maritime operations,
ie. that indicate vessels as sanctioned entities.

The CSV data structure is as follows:
- **type**: Either VESSEL, or ORGANIZATION. Organizations are only included, if one of our
  data sources provides an IMO number assigned to that company or entity. All vessels are
  included in the data export, irrespective of whether an IMO number is available or not.
- **caption**: The name of the vessel or organization. See [caption](/faq/24/captions/) on how
  a name is picked from available candidates.
- **imo**: The IMO number of the vessel or organization. This is a unique identifier for vessels
  and organizations. IMO numbers are assigned by the International Maritime Organization, and
  different schemes are used for vessels and organizations. If no IMO number is available for
  a vessel, the field is empty. In those cases, more brittle matching on name may be required.
- **risk**: Whether the vessel or organization is directly sanctioned, or is mentioned on a
  watchlist in a secondary capacity. See [topics](/docs/topics/).
- **countries**: All countries that the vessel or organization has been linked to.
- **flag**: The flag of the vessel. This is the country that the vessel is registered in.
- **mmsi**: The MMSI number of the vessel. This is a unique identifier for vessels, and is
  assigned by the International Telecommunication Union (ITU). It is used for maritime
  communication and navigation. If no MMSI number is available for a vessel, the field is empty.
- **id**: The OpenSanctions ID for the vessel or organization.
- **url**: Link to the OpenSanctions profile regarding the vessel or organization.
- **datasets**: The list of datasets that mention the vessel or organization. This is a list of
  OpenSanctions dataset IDs, and can be used to find out where the data comes from.
- **aliases**: A list of all names that are linked to the vessel or organization, except for
  the name that is used in the `name` field.

datasets.name: us_oh_med_exclusions
datasets.title: US Ohio Medicaid Excluded and Suspended Providers
datasets.summary: Medical providers excluded or suspended from Ohio's Medicaid program.
datasets.description:
This dataset contains information about individuals and entities excluded or suspended
from the Ohio State Medicaid Program. The following text extracted from their website
explains the provisions taken:

 > If an individual or company is on the list, the individual or company may not be an
 > owner in whole or in part; officer or partner; authorized agent, associate, manager,
 > or employee of a Medicaid provider. The individual or company is prohibited from
 > owning, contracting for, arranging for rendering or ordering services for Medicaid
 > recipients or receiving direct or indirect reimbursement of Medicaid funds in the
 > form of salary, shared fees, contracts, kickbacks, or rebates from or through any
 > participating provider or risk contractor.

publisher.name: Ohio Department of Medicaid
publisher.description:
The Ohio Department of Medicaid (ODM) is the state agency that administers the delivery
healthcare to Ohio residents.

datasets.name: peps
datasets.title: Politically Exposed Persons Datasets
datasets.summary: A politically exposed person (PEP) is a person that has been entrusted with a prominent public function. PEPs include elected officials and members of government.
datasets.description:
This collection contains data about politically exposed persons (PEPs) from

**IMPORTANT: We discourage the use of this collection on its own, as it does

The “My Members of Parliament” platform is
a private initiative that was founded in 2011 by Respect.net
and operated together with WOTI World of Tomorrow Institute
